module Amazonka.Grafana.Types.AssertionAttributes

-- | A structure that defines which attributes in the IdP assertion are to
--   be used to define information about the users authenticated by the IdP
--   to use the workspace.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAssertionAttributes</a> smart constructor.
data AssertionAttributes
AssertionAttributes' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> AssertionAttributes

-- | The name of the attribute within the SAML assertion to use as the
--   email names for SAML users.
[$sel:email:AssertionAttributes'] :: AssertionAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the attribute within the SAML assertion to use as the user
--   full "friendly" names for user groups.
[$sel:groups:AssertionAttributes'] :: AssertionAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the attribute within the SAML assertion to use as the user
--   full "friendly" names for the users' organizations.
[$sel:org:AssertionAttributes'] :: AssertionAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the attribute within the SAML assertion to use as the user
--   roles.
[$sel:role':AssertionAttributes'] :: AssertionAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the attribute within the SAML assertion to use as the user
--   full "friendly" names for SAML users.
[$sel:name:AssertionAttributes'] :: AssertionAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the attribute within the SAML assertion to use as the
--   login names for SAML users.
[$sel:login:AssertionAttributes'] :: AssertionAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AssertionAttributes</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--

--   the SAML assertion to use as the user full "friendly" names for user
--   groups.
--   
--   <a>$sel:org:AssertionAttributes'</a>, <a>assertionAttributes_org</a> -
--   The name of the attribute within the SAML assertion to use as the user
--   full "friendly" names for the users' organizations.

module Amazonka.Grafana.Types.IdpMetadata

-- | A structure containing the identity provider (IdP) metadata used to
--   integrate the identity provider with this workspace. You can specify
--   the metadata either by providing a URL to its location in the
--   <tt>url</tt> parameter, or by specifying the full metadata in XML
--   format in the <tt>xml</tt> parameter.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newIdpMetadata</a> smart constructor.
data IdpMetadata
IdpMetadata' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> IdpMetadata

-- | The URL of the location containing the metadata.
[$sel:url:IdpMetadata'] :: IdpMetadata -> Maybe Text

-- | The actual full metadata file, in XML format.
[$sel:xml:IdpMetadata'] :: IdpMetadata -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>IdpMetadata</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:url:IdpMetadata'</a>, <a>idpMetadata_url</a> - The URL of the
--   location containing the metadata.
--   
--   <a>$sel:xml:IdpMetadata'</a>, <a>idpMetadata_xml</a> - The actual full
--   metadata file, in XML format.
newIdpMetadata :: IdpMetadata

-- | The URL of the location containing the metadata.
idpMetadata_url :: Lens' IdpMetadata (Maybe Text)

-- | The actual full metadata file, in XML format.
idpMetadata_xml :: Lens' IdpMetadata (Maybe Text)

module Amazonka.Grafana.Types.RoleValues

-- | This structure defines which groups defined in the SAML assertion
--   attribute are to be mapped to the Grafana <tt>Admin</tt> and
--   <tt>Editor</tt> roles in the workspace.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRoleValues</a> smart constructor.
data RoleValues
RoleValues' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> RoleValues

-- | A list of groups from the SAML assertion attribute to grant the
--   Grafana <tt>Admin</tt> role to.
[$sel:admin:RoleValues'] :: RoleValues -> Maybe [Text]

-- | A list of groups from the SAML assertion attribute to grant the
--   Grafana <tt>Editor</tt> role to.
[$sel:editor:RoleValues'] :: RoleValues -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>RoleValues</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:admin:RoleValues'</a>, <a>roleValues_admin</a> - A list of
--   groups from the SAML assertion attribute to grant the Grafana
--   <tt>Admin</tt> role to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:editor:RoleValues'</a>, <a>roleValues_editor</a> - A list of
--   groups from the SAML assertion attribute to grant the Grafana
--   <tt>Editor</tt> role to.
newRoleValues :: RoleValues

-- | A list of groups from the SAML assertion attribute to grant the
--   Grafana <tt>Admin</tt> role to.
roleValues_admin :: Lens' RoleValues (Maybe [Text])

-- | A list of groups from the SAML assertion attribute to grant the
--   Grafana <tt>Editor</tt> role to.
roleValues_editor :: Lens' RoleValues (Maybe [Text])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Grafana.Types.RoleValues.RoleValues
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Grafana.Types.RoleValues.RoleValues
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.Grafana.Types.RoleValues.RoleValues
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Grafana.Types.RoleValues.RoleValues
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.Grafana.Types.RoleValues.RoleValues
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.Grafana.Types.RoleValues.RoleValues
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Grafana.Types.RoleValues.RoleValues
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.Grafana.Types.RoleValues.RoleValues


module Amazonka.Grafana.Types.SamlConfiguration

-- | A structure containing information about how this workspace works with
--   SAML.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSamlConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data SamlConfiguration
SamlConfiguration' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe AssertionAttributes -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe RoleValues -> IdpMetadata -> SamlConfiguration

-- | How long a sign-on session by a SAML user is valid, before the user
--   has to sign on again.
[$sel:loginValidityDuration:SamlConfiguration'] :: SamlConfiguration -> Maybe Int

-- | A structure that defines which attributes in the SAML assertion are to
--   be used to define information about the users authenticated by that
--   IdP to use the workspace.
[$sel:assertionAttributes:SamlConfiguration'] :: SamlConfiguration -> Maybe AssertionAttributes

-- | Lists which organizations defined in the SAML assertion are allowed to
--   use the Amazon Managed Grafana workspace. If this is empty, all
--   organizations in the assertion attribute have access.
[$sel:allowedOrganizations:SamlConfiguration'] :: SamlConfiguration -> Maybe [Text]

-- | A structure containing arrays that map group names in the SAML
--   assertion to the Grafana <tt>Admin</tt> and <tt>Editor</tt> roles in
--   the workspace.
[$sel:roleValues:SamlConfiguration'] :: SamlConfiguration -> Maybe RoleValues

-- | A structure containing the identity provider (IdP) metadata used to
--   integrate the identity provider with this workspace.
[$sel:idpMetadata:SamlConfiguration'] :: SamlConfiguration -> IdpMetadata

-- | Create a value of <a>SamlConfiguration</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:loginValidityDuration:SamlConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>samlConfiguration_loginValidityDuration</a> - How long a sign-on
--   session by a SAML user is valid, before the user has to sign on again.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assertionAttributes:SamlConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>samlConfiguration_assertionAttributes</a> - A structure that
--   defines which attributes in the SAML assertion are to be used to
--   define information about the users authenticated by that IdP to use
--   the workspace.
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowedOrganizations:SamlConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>samlConfiguration_allowedOrganizations</a> - Lists which
--   organizations defined in the SAML assertion are allowed to use the
--   Amazon Managed Grafana workspace. If this is empty, all organizations
--   in the assertion attribute have access.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleValues:SamlConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>samlConfiguration_roleValues</a> - A structure containing arrays
--   that map group names in the SAML assertion to the Grafana
--   <tt>Admin</tt> and <tt>Editor</tt> roles in the workspace.
--   
--   <a>$sel:idpMetadata:SamlConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>samlConfiguration_idpMetadata</a> - A structure containing the
--   identity provider (IdP) metadata used to integrate the identity
--   provider with this workspace.
newSamlConfiguration :: IdpMetadata -> SamlConfiguration

-- | How long a sign-on session by a SAML user is valid, before the user
--   has to sign on again.
samlConfiguration_loginValidityDuration :: Lens' SamlConfiguration (Maybe Int)

-- | A structure that defines which attributes in the SAML assertion are to
--   be used to define information about the users authenticated by that
--   IdP to use the workspace.
samlConfiguration_assertionAttributes :: Lens' SamlConfiguration (Maybe AssertionAttributes)

-- | Lists which organizations defined in the SAML assertion are allowed to
--   use the Amazon Managed Grafana workspace. If this is empty, all
--   organizations in the assertion attribute have access.
samlConfiguration_allowedOrganizations :: Lens' SamlConfiguration (Maybe [Text])

-- | A structure containing arrays that map group names in the SAML
--   assertion to the Grafana <tt>Admin</tt> and <tt>Editor</tt> roles in
--   the workspace.
samlConfiguration_roleValues :: Lens' SamlConfiguration (Maybe RoleValues)

-- | A structure containing the identity provider (IdP) metadata used to
--   integrate the identity provider with this workspace.
samlConfiguration_idpMetadata :: Lens' SamlConfiguration IdpMetadata
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Grafana.Types.SamlConfiguration.SamlConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Grafana.Types.SamlConfiguration.SamlConfiguration
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.Grafana.Types.SamlConfiguration.SamlConfiguration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Grafana.Types.SamlConfiguration.SamlConfiguration
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.Grafana.Types.SamlConfiguration.SamlConfiguration
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.Grafana.Types.SamlConfiguration.SamlConfiguration
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Grafana.Types.SamlConfiguration.SamlConfiguration
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.Grafana.Types.SamlConfiguration.SamlConfiguration


module Amazonka.Grafana.Types.SamlConfigurationStatus
newtype SamlConfigurationStatus
SamlConfigurationStatus' :: Text -> SamlConfigurationStatus
[fromSamlConfigurationStatus] :: SamlConfigurationStatus -> Text
pattern SamlConfigurationStatus_CONFIGURED :: SamlConfigurationStatus
pattern SamlConfigurationStatus_NOT_CONFIGURED :: SamlConfigurationStatus
instance Amazonka.Data.XML.ToXML Amazonka.Grafana.Types.SamlConfigurationStatus.SamlConfigurationStatus
instance Amazonka.Data.XML.FromXML Amazonka.Grafana.Types.SamlConfigurationStatus.SamlConfigurationStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSONKey Amazonka.Grafana.Types.SamlConfigurationStatus.SamlConfigurationStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.Grafana.Types.SamlConfigurationStatus.SamlConfigurationStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSONKey Amazonka.Grafana.Types.SamlConfigurationStatus.SamlConfigurationStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.Grafana.Types.SamlConfigurationStatus.SamlConfigurationStatus
instance Amazonka.Data.Query.ToQuery Amazonka.Grafana.Types.SamlConfigurationStatus.SamlConfigurationStatus
instance Amazonka.Data.Headers.ToHeader Amazonka.Grafana.Types.SamlConfigurationStatus.SamlConfigurationStatus
instance Amazonka.Data.Log.ToLog Amazonka.Grafana.Types.SamlConfigurationStatus.SamlConfigurationStatus
instance Amazonka.Data.ByteString.ToByteString Amazonka.Grafana.Types.SamlConfigurationStatus.SamlConfigurationStatus
instance Amazonka.Data.Text.ToText Amazonka.Grafana.Types.SamlConfigurationStatus.SamlConfigurationStatus
instance Amazonka.Data.Text.FromText Amazonka.Grafana.Types.SamlConfigurationStatus.SamlConfigurationStatus
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Grafana.Types.SamlConfigurationStatus.SamlConfigurationStatus
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.Grafana.Types.SamlConfigurationStatus.SamlConfigurationStatus
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Grafana.Types.SamlConfigurationStatus.SamlConfigurationStatus
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Amazonka.Grafana.Types.SamlConfigurationStatus.SamlConfigurationStatus
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Grafana.Types.SamlConfigurationStatus.SamlConfigurationStatus
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.Grafana.Types.SamlConfigurationStatus.SamlConfigurationStatus
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Grafana.Types.SamlConfigurationStatus.SamlConfigurationStatus


module Amazonka.Grafana.Types.SamlAuthentication

-- | A structure containing information about how this workspace works with
--   SAML.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSamlAuthentication</a> smart constructor.
data SamlAuthentication
SamlAuthentication' :: Maybe SamlConfiguration -> SamlConfigurationStatus -> SamlAuthentication

-- | A structure containing details about how this workspace works with
--   SAML.
[$sel:configuration:SamlAuthentication'] :: SamlAuthentication -> Maybe SamlConfiguration

-- | Specifies whether the workspace's SAML configuration is complete.
[$sel:status:SamlAuthentication'] :: SamlAuthentication -> SamlConfigurationStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>SamlAuthentication</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:configuration:SamlAuthentication'</a>,
--   <a>samlAuthentication_configuration</a> - A structure containing
--   details about how this workspace works with SAML.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:SamlAuthentication'</a>,
--   <a>samlAuthentication_status</a> - Specifies whether the workspace's
--   SAML configuration is complete.
newSamlAuthentication :: SamlConfigurationStatus -> SamlAuthentication

-- | A structure containing details about how this workspace works with
--   SAML.
samlAuthentication_configuration :: Lens' SamlAuthentication (Maybe SamlConfiguration)

-- | Specifies whether the workspace's SAML configuration is complete.
samlAuthentication_status :: Lens' SamlAuthentication SamlConfigurationStatus
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Grafana.Types.SamlAuthentication.SamlAuthentication
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Grafana.Types.SamlAuthentication.SamlAuthentication
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.Grafana.Types.SamlAuthentication.SamlAuthentication
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Grafana.Types.SamlAuthentication.SamlAuthentication
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.Grafana.Types.SamlAuthentication.SamlAuthentication
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.Grafana.Types.SamlAuthentication.SamlAuthentication
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Grafana.Types.SamlAuthentication.SamlAuthentication


module Amazonka.Grafana.Types.AuthenticationDescription

-- | A structure containing information about the user authentication
--   methods used by the workspace.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAuthenticationDescription</a> smart constructor.
data AuthenticationDescription
AuthenticationDescription' :: Maybe AwsSsoAuthentication -> Maybe SamlAuthentication -> [AuthenticationProviderTypes] -> AuthenticationDescription

-- | A structure containing information about how this workspace works with
--   Amazon Web Services SSO.
[$sel:awsSso:AuthenticationDescription'] :: AuthenticationDescription -> Maybe AwsSsoAuthentication

-- | A structure containing information about how this workspace works with
--   SAML, including what attributes within the assertion are to be mapped
--   to user information in the workspace.
[$sel:saml:AuthenticationDescription'] :: AuthenticationDescription -> Maybe SamlAuthentication

-- | Specifies whether this workspace uses Amazon Web Services SSO, SAML,
--   or both methods to authenticate users to use the Grafana console in
--   the Amazon Managed Grafana workspace.
[$sel:providers:AuthenticationDescription'] :: AuthenticationDescription -> [AuthenticationProviderTypes]

-- | Create a value of <a>AuthenticationDescription</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:awsSso:AuthenticationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>authenticationDescription_awsSso</a> - A structure containing
--   information about how this workspace works with Amazon Web Services
--   SSO.
--   
--   <a>$sel:saml:AuthenticationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>authenticationDescription_saml</a> - A structure containing
--   information about how this workspace works with SAML, including what
--   attributes within the assertion are to be mapped to user information
--   in the workspace.
--   
--   <a>$sel:providers:AuthenticationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>authenticationDescription_providers</a> - Specifies whether this
--   workspace uses Amazon Web Services SSO, SAML, or both methods to
--   authenticate users to use the Grafana console in the Amazon Managed
--   Grafana workspace.
newAuthenticationDescription :: AuthenticationDescription

-- | A structure containing information about how this workspace works with
--   Amazon Web Services SSO.
authenticationDescription_awsSso :: Lens' AuthenticationDescription (Maybe AwsSsoAuthentication)

-- | A structure containing information about how this workspace works with
--   SAML, including what attributes within the assertion are to be mapped
--   to user information in the workspace.
authenticationDescription_saml :: Lens' AuthenticationDescription (Maybe SamlAuthentication)

-- | Specifies whether this workspace uses Amazon Web Services SSO, SAML,
--   or both methods to authenticate users to use the Grafana console in
--   the Amazon Managed Grafana workspace.
authenticationDescription_providers :: Lens' AuthenticationDescription [AuthenticationProviderTypes]
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Grafana.Types.AuthenticationDescription.AuthenticationDescription
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Grafana.Types.AuthenticationDescription.AuthenticationDescription
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.Grafana.Types.AuthenticationDescription.AuthenticationDescription
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Grafana.Types.AuthenticationDescription.AuthenticationDescription
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.Grafana.Types.AuthenticationDescription.AuthenticationDescription
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.Grafana.Types.AuthenticationDescription.AuthenticationDescription
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Grafana.Types.AuthenticationDescription.AuthenticationDescription


module Amazonka.Grafana.Types.AuthenticationSummary

-- | A structure that describes whether the workspace uses SAML, Amazon Web
--   Services SSO, or both methods for user authentication, and whether
--   that authentication is fully configured.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAuthenticationSummary</a> smart constructor.
data AuthenticationSummary
AuthenticationSummary' :: Maybe SamlConfigurationStatus -> [AuthenticationProviderTypes] -> AuthenticationSummary

-- | Specifies whether the workplace's user authentication method is fully
--   configured.
[$sel:samlConfigurationStatus:AuthenticationSummary'] :: AuthenticationSummary -> Maybe SamlConfigurationStatus

-- | Specifies whether the workspace uses SAML, Amazon Web Services SSO, or
--   both methods for user authentication.
[$sel:providers:AuthenticationSummary'] :: AuthenticationSummary -> [AuthenticationProviderTypes]

-- | Create a value of <a>AuthenticationSummary</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:samlConfigurationStatus:AuthenticationSummary'</a>,
--   <a>authenticationSummary_samlConfigurationStatus</a> - Specifies
--   whether the workplace's user authentication method is fully
--   configured.
--   
--   <a>$sel:providers:AuthenticationSummary'</a>,
--   <a>authenticationSummary_providers</a> - Specifies whether the
--   workspace uses SAML, Amazon Web Services SSO, or both methods for user
--   authentication.
newAuthenticationSummary :: AuthenticationSummary

-- | Specifies whether the workplace's user authentication method is fully
--   configured.
authenticationSummary_samlConfigurationStatus :: Lens' AuthenticationSummary (Maybe SamlConfigurationStatus)

-- | Specifies whether the workspace uses SAML, Amazon Web Services SSO, or
--   both methods for user authentication.
authenticationSummary_providers :: Lens' AuthenticationSummary [AuthenticationProviderTypes]
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Grafana.Types.AuthenticationSummary.AuthenticationSummary
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Grafana.Types.AuthenticationSummary.AuthenticationSummary
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.Grafana.Types.AuthenticationSummary.AuthenticationSummary
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Grafana.Types.AuthenticationSummary.AuthenticationSummary
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.Grafana.Types.AuthenticationSummary.AuthenticationSummary
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.Grafana.Types.AuthenticationSummary.AuthenticationSummary
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Grafana.Types.AuthenticationSummary.AuthenticationSummary

module Amazonka.Grafana.Types.User

-- | A structure that specifies one user or group in the workspace.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUser</a> smart constructor.
data User
User' :: Text -> UserType -> User

-- | The ID of the user or group.
[$sel:id:User'] :: User -> Text

-- | Specifies whether this is a single user or a group.
[$sel:type':User'] :: User -> UserType

-- | Create a value of <a>User</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:User'</a>, <a>user_id</a> - The ID of the user or group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':User'</a>, <a>user_type</a> - Specifies whether this is
--   a single user or a group.
newUser :: Text -> UserType -> User

-- | The ID of the user or group.
user_id :: Lens' User Text

-- | Specifies whether this is a single user or a group.
user_type :: Lens' User UserType
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Grafana.Types.User.User
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Grafana.Types.User.User
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.Grafana.Types.User.User
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Grafana.Types.User.User
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.Grafana.Types.User.User
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.Grafana.Types.User.User
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Grafana.Types.User.User
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.Grafana.Types.User.User


module Amazonka.Grafana.Types.UpdateInstruction

-- | Contains the instructions for one Grafana role permission update in a
--   <a>UpdatePermissions</a> operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateInstruction</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateInstruction
UpdateInstruction' :: UpdateAction -> Role -> [User] -> UpdateInstruction

-- | Specifies whether this update is to add or revoke role permissions.
[$sel:action:UpdateInstruction'] :: UpdateInstruction -> UpdateAction

-- | The role to add or revoke for the user or the group specified in
--   <tt>users</tt>.
[$sel:role':UpdateInstruction'] :: UpdateInstruction -> Role

-- | A structure that specifies the user or group to add or revoke the role
--   for.
[$sel:users:UpdateInstruction'] :: UpdateInstruction -> [User]

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateInstruction</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:action:UpdateInstruction'</a>, <a>updateInstruction_action</a>
--   - Specifies whether this update is to add or revoke role permissions.
--   
--   <a>$sel:role':UpdateInstruction'</a>, <a>updateInstruction_role</a> -
--   The role to add or revoke for the user or the group specified in
--   <tt>users</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:users:UpdateInstruction'</a>, <a>updateInstruction_users</a> -
--   A structure that specifies the user or group to add or revoke the role
--   for.
newUpdateInstruction :: UpdateAction -> Role -> UpdateInstruction

-- | Specifies whether this update is to add or revoke role permissions.
updateInstruction_action :: Lens' UpdateInstruction UpdateAction

-- | The role to add or revoke for the user or the group specified in
--   <tt>users</tt>.
updateInstruction_role :: Lens' UpdateInstruction Role

-- | A structure that specifies the user or group to add or revoke the role
--   for.
updateInstruction_users :: Lens' UpdateInstruction [User]
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Grafana.Types.UpdateInstruction.UpdateInstruction
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Grafana.Types.UpdateInstruction.UpdateInstruction
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.Grafana.Types.UpdateInstruction.UpdateInstruction
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Grafana.Types.UpdateInstruction.UpdateInstruction
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.Grafana.Types.UpdateInstruction.UpdateInstruction
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.Grafana.Types.UpdateInstruction.UpdateInstruction
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Grafana.Types.UpdateInstruction.UpdateInstruction
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.Grafana.Types.UpdateInstruction.UpdateInstruction


module Amazonka.Grafana.Types.UpdateError

-- | A structure containing information about one error encountered while
--   performing an <a>UpdatePermissions</a> operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateError</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateError
UpdateError' :: UpdateInstruction -> Natural -> Text -> UpdateError

-- | Specifies which permission update caused the error.
[$sel:causedBy:UpdateError'] :: UpdateError -> UpdateInstruction

-- | The error code.
[$sel:code:UpdateError'] :: UpdateError -> Natural

-- | The message for this error.
[$sel:message:UpdateError'] :: UpdateError -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateError</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:causedBy:UpdateError'</a>, <a>updateError_causedBy</a> -
--   Specifies which permission update caused the error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:code:UpdateError'</a>, <a>updateError_code</a> - The error
--   code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:message:UpdateError'</a>, <a>updateError_message</a> - The
--   message for this error.
newUpdateError :: UpdateInstruction -> Natural -> Text -> UpdateError

-- | Specifies which permission update caused the error.
updateError_causedBy :: Lens' UpdateError UpdateInstruction

-- | The error code.
updateError_code :: Lens' UpdateError Natural

-- | The message for this error.
updateError_message :: Lens' UpdateError Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Grafana.Types.UpdateError.UpdateError
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Grafana.Types.UpdateError.UpdateError
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.Grafana.Types.UpdateError.UpdateError
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Grafana.Types.UpdateError.UpdateError
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.Grafana.Types.UpdateError.UpdateError
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.Grafana.Types.UpdateError.UpdateError
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Grafana.Types.UpdateError.UpdateError


module Amazonka.Grafana.Types.PermissionEntry

-- | A structure containing the identity of one user or group and the
--   <tt>Admin</tt> or <tt>Editor</tt> role that they have.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPermissionEntry</a> smart constructor.
data PermissionEntry
PermissionEntry' :: Role -> User -> PermissionEntry

-- | Specifies whether the user or group has the <tt>Admin</tt> or
--   <tt>Editor</tt> role.
[$sel:role':PermissionEntry'] :: PermissionEntry -> Role

-- | A structure with the ID of the user or group with this role.
[$sel:user:PermissionEntry'] :: PermissionEntry -> User

-- | Create a value of <a>PermissionEntry</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:role':PermissionEntry'</a>, <a>permissionEntry_role</a> -
--   Specifies whether the user or group has the <tt>Admin</tt> or
--   <tt>Editor</tt> role.
--   
--   <a>$sel:user:PermissionEntry'</a>, <a>permissionEntry_user</a> - A
--   structure with the ID of the user or group with this role.
newPermissionEntry :: Role -> User -> PermissionEntry

-- | Specifies whether the user or group has the <tt>Admin</tt> or
--   <tt>Editor</tt> role.
permissionEntry_role :: Lens' PermissionEntry Role

-- | A structure with the ID of the user or group with this role.
permissionEntry_user :: Lens' PermissionEntry User
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Grafana.Types.PermissionEntry.PermissionEntry
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Grafana.Types.PermissionEntry.PermissionEntry
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.Grafana.Types.PermissionEntry.PermissionEntry
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Grafana.Types.PermissionEntry.PermissionEntry
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.Grafana.Types.PermissionEntry.PermissionEntry
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.Grafana.Types.PermissionEntry.PermissionEntry
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Grafana.Types.PermissionEntry.PermissionEntry


module Amazonka.Grafana.Types.WorkspaceStatus
newtype WorkspaceStatus
WorkspaceStatus' :: Text -> WorkspaceStatus
[fromWorkspaceStatus] :: WorkspaceStatus -> Text
pattern WorkspaceStatus_ACTIVE :: WorkspaceStatus
pattern WorkspaceStatus_CREATING :: WorkspaceStatus
pattern WorkspaceStatus_CREATION_FAILED :: WorkspaceStatus
pattern WorkspaceStatus_DELETING :: WorkspaceStatus
pattern WorkspaceStatus_DELETION_FAILED :: WorkspaceStatus
pattern WorkspaceStatus_FAILED :: WorkspaceStatus
pattern WorkspaceStatus_LICENSE_REMOVAL_FAILED :: WorkspaceStatus
pattern WorkspaceStatus_UPDATE_FAILED :: WorkspaceStatus
pattern WorkspaceStatus_UPDATING :: WorkspaceStatus
pattern WorkspaceStatus_UPGRADE_FAILED :: WorkspaceStatus
pattern WorkspaceStatus_UPGRADING :: WorkspaceStatus
instance Amazonka.Data.XML.ToXML Amazonka.Grafana.Types.WorkspaceStatus.WorkspaceStatus
instance Amazonka.Data.XML.FromXML Amazonka.Grafana.Types.WorkspaceStatus.WorkspaceStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSONKey Amazonka.Grafana.Types.WorkspaceStatus.WorkspaceStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.Grafana.Types.WorkspaceStatus.WorkspaceStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSONKey Amazonka.Grafana.Types.WorkspaceStatus.WorkspaceStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.Grafana.Types.WorkspaceStatus.WorkspaceStatus
instance Amazonka.Data.Query.ToQuery Amazonka.Grafana.Types.WorkspaceStatus.WorkspaceStatus
instance Amazonka.Data.Headers.ToHeader Amazonka.Grafana.Types.WorkspaceStatus.WorkspaceStatus
instance Amazonka.Data.Log.ToLog Amazonka.Grafana.Types.WorkspaceStatus.WorkspaceStatus
instance Amazonka.Data.ByteString.ToByteString Amazonka.Grafana.Types.WorkspaceStatus.WorkspaceStatus
instance Amazonka.Data.Text.ToText Amazonka.Grafana.Types.WorkspaceStatus.WorkspaceStatus
instance Amazonka.Data.Text.FromText Amazonka.Grafana.Types.WorkspaceStatus.WorkspaceStatus
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Grafana.Types.WorkspaceStatus.WorkspaceStatus
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.Grafana.Types.WorkspaceStatus.WorkspaceStatus
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Grafana.Types.WorkspaceStatus.WorkspaceStatus
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Amazonka.Grafana.Types.WorkspaceStatus.WorkspaceStatus
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Grafana.Types.WorkspaceStatus.WorkspaceStatus
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.Grafana.Types.WorkspaceStatus.WorkspaceStatus
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Grafana.Types.WorkspaceStatus.WorkspaceStatus


module Amazonka.Grafana.Types.WorkspaceDescription

-- | A structure containing information about an Amazon Managed Grafana
--   workspace in your account.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWorkspaceDescription</a> smart constructor.
data WorkspaceDescription
WorkspaceDescription' :: Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe LicenseType -> Maybe PermissionType -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe [NotificationDestinationType] -> Maybe AccountAccessType -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (Sensitive [Text]) -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe Bool -> AuthenticationSummary -> POSIX -> [DataSourceType] -> Text -> Text -> Text -> POSIX -> WorkspaceStatus -> WorkspaceDescription

-- | The IAM role that grants permissions to the Amazon Web Services
--   resources that the workspace will view data from. This role must
--   already exist.
[$sel:workspaceRoleArn:WorkspaceDescription'] :: WorkspaceDescription -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | If this workspace is currently in the free trial period for Grafana
--   Enterprise, this value specifies when that free trial ends.
[$sel:freeTrialExpiration:WorkspaceDescription'] :: WorkspaceDescription -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Specifies whether this workspace has a full Grafana Enterprise license
--   or a free trial license.
[$sel:licenseType:WorkspaceDescription'] :: WorkspaceDescription -> Maybe LicenseType

-- | If this is <tt>Service Managed</tt>, Amazon Managed Grafana
--   automatically creates the IAM roles and provisions the permissions
--   that the workspace needs to use Amazon Web Services data sources and
--   notification channels.
--   
--   If this is <tt>CUSTOMER_MANAGED</tt>, you manage those roles and
--   permissions yourself. If you are creating this workspace in a member
--   account of an organization and that account is not a delegated
--   administrator account, and you want the workspace to access data
--   sources in other Amazon Web Services accounts in the organization, you
--   must choose <tt>CUSTOMER_MANAGED</tt>.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Amazon Managed Grafana permissions and
--   policies for Amazon Web Services data sources and notification
--   channels</a>
[$sel:permissionType:WorkspaceDescription'] :: WorkspaceDescription -> Maybe PermissionType

-- | The name of the workspace.
[$sel:name:WorkspaceDescription'] :: WorkspaceDescription -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | The Amazon Web Services notification channels that Amazon Managed
--   Grafana can automatically create IAM roles and permissions for, to
--   allow Amazon Managed Grafana to use these channels.
[$sel:notificationDestinations:WorkspaceDescription'] :: WorkspaceDescription -> Maybe [NotificationDestinationType]

-- | Specifies whether the workspace can access Amazon Web Services
--   resources in this Amazon Web Services account only, or whether it can
--   also access Amazon Web Services resources in other accounts in the
--   same organization. If this is <tt>ORGANIZATION</tt>, the
--   <tt>workspaceOrganizationalUnits</tt> parameter specifies which
--   organizational units the workspace can access.
[$sel:accountAccessType:WorkspaceDescription'] :: WorkspaceDescription -> Maybe AccountAccessType

-- | If this workspace has a full Grafana Enterprise license, this
--   specifies when the license ends and will need to be renewed.
[$sel:licenseExpiration:WorkspaceDescription'] :: WorkspaceDescription -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The name of the IAM role that is used to access resources through
--   Organizations.
[$sel:organizationRoleName:WorkspaceDescription'] :: WorkspaceDescription -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | The name of the CloudFormation stack set that is used to generate IAM
--   roles to be used for this workspace.
[$sel:stackSetName:WorkspaceDescription'] :: WorkspaceDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the organizational units that this workspace is allowed to
--   use data sources from, if this workspace is in an account that is part
--   of an organization.
[$sel:organizationalUnits:WorkspaceDescription'] :: WorkspaceDescription -> Maybe (Sensitive [Text])

-- | The user-defined description of the workspace.
[$sel:description:WorkspaceDescription'] :: WorkspaceDescription -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | Specifies whether this workspace has already fully used its free trial
--   for Grafana Enterprise.
[$sel:freeTrialConsumed:WorkspaceDescription'] :: WorkspaceDescription -> Maybe Bool

-- | A structure that describes whether the workspace uses SAML, Amazon Web
--   Services SSO, or both methods for user authentication.
[$sel:authentication:WorkspaceDescription'] :: WorkspaceDescription -> AuthenticationSummary

-- | The date that the workspace was created.
[$sel:created:WorkspaceDescription'] :: WorkspaceDescription -> POSIX

-- | Specifies the Amazon Web Services data sources that have been
--   configured to have IAM roles and permissions created to allow Amazon
--   Managed Grafana to read data from these sources.
[$sel:dataSources:WorkspaceDescription'] :: WorkspaceDescription -> [DataSourceType]

-- | The URL that users can use to access the Grafana console in the
--   workspace.
[$sel:endpoint:WorkspaceDescription'] :: WorkspaceDescription -> Text

-- | The version of Grafana supported in this workspace.
[$sel:grafanaVersion:WorkspaceDescription'] :: WorkspaceDescription -> Text

-- | The unique ID of this workspace.
[$sel:id:WorkspaceDescription'] :: WorkspaceDescription -> Text

-- | The most recent date that the workspace was modified.
[$sel:modified:WorkspaceDescription'] :: WorkspaceDescription -> POSIX

-- | The current status of the workspace.
[$sel:status:WorkspaceDescription'] :: WorkspaceDescription -> WorkspaceStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>WorkspaceDescription</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:workspaceRoleArn:WorkspaceDescription'</a>,
--   <a>workspaceDescription_workspaceRoleArn</a> - The IAM role that
--   grants permissions to the Amazon Web Services resources that the
--   workspace will view data from. This role must already exist.
--   
--   <a>$sel:freeTrialExpiration:WorkspaceDescription'</a>,
--   <a>workspaceDescription_freeTrialExpiration</a> - If this workspace is
--   currently in the free trial period for Grafana Enterprise, this value
--   specifies when that free trial ends.
--   
--   <a>$sel:licenseType:WorkspaceDescription'</a>,
--   <a>workspaceDescription_licenseType</a> - Specifies whether this
--   workspace has a full Grafana Enterprise license or a free trial
--   license.
--   
--   <a>$sel:permissionType:WorkspaceDescription'</a>,
--   <a>workspaceDescription_permissionType</a> - If this is <tt>Service
--   Managed</tt>, Amazon Managed Grafana automatically creates the IAM
--   roles and provisions the permissions that the workspace needs to use
--   Amazon Web Services data sources and notification channels.
--   
--   If this is <tt>CUSTOMER_MANAGED</tt>, you manage those roles and
--   permissions yourself. If you are creating this workspace in a member
--   account of an organization and that account is not a delegated
--   administrator account, and you want the workspace to access data
--   sources in other Amazon Web Services accounts in the organization, you
--   must choose <tt>CUSTOMER_MANAGED</tt>.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Amazon Managed Grafana permissions and
--   policies for Amazon Web Services data sources and notification
--   channels</a>
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:WorkspaceDescription'</a>,
--   <a>workspaceDescription_name</a> - The name of the workspace.
--   
--   <a>$sel:notificationDestinations:WorkspaceDescription'</a>,
--   <a>workspaceDescription_notificationDestinations</a> - The Amazon Web
--   Services notification channels that Amazon Managed Grafana can
--   automatically create IAM roles and permissions for, to allow Amazon
--   Managed Grafana to use these channels.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountAccessType:WorkspaceDescription'</a>,
--   <a>workspaceDescription_accountAccessType</a> - Specifies whether the
--   workspace can access Amazon Web Services resources in this Amazon Web
--   Services account only, or whether it can also access Amazon Web
--   Services resources in other accounts in the same organization. If this
--   is <tt>ORGANIZATION</tt>, the <tt>workspaceOrganizationalUnits</tt>
--   parameter specifies which organizational units the workspace can
--   access.
--   
--   <a>$sel:licenseExpiration:WorkspaceDescription'</a>,
--   <a>workspaceDescription_licenseExpiration</a> - If this workspace has
--   a full Grafana Enterprise license, this specifies when the license
--   ends and will need to be renewed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:organizationRoleName:WorkspaceDescription'</a>,
--   <a>workspaceDescription_organizationRoleName</a> - The name of the IAM
--   role that is used to access resources through Organizations.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackSetName:WorkspaceDescription'</a>,
--   <a>workspaceDescription_stackSetName</a> - The name of the
--   CloudFormation stack set that is used to generate IAM roles to be used
--   for this workspace.
--   
--   <a>$sel:organizationalUnits:WorkspaceDescription'</a>,
--   <a>workspaceDescription_organizationalUnits</a> - Specifies the
--   organizational units that this workspace is allowed to use data
--   sources from, if this workspace is in an account that is part of an
--   organization.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:WorkspaceDescription'</a>,
--   <a>workspaceDescription_description</a> - The user-defined description
--   of the workspace.
--   
--   <a>$sel:freeTrialConsumed:WorkspaceDescription'</a>,
--   <a>workspaceDescription_freeTrialConsumed</a> - Specifies whether this
--   workspace has already fully used its free trial for Grafana
--   Enterprise.
--   
--   <a>$sel:authentication:WorkspaceDescription'</a>,
--   <a>workspaceDescription_authentication</a> - A structure that
--   describes whether the workspace uses SAML, Amazon Web Services SSO, or
--   both methods for user authentication.
--   
--   <a>$sel:created:WorkspaceDescription'</a>,
--   <a>workspaceDescription_created</a> - The date that the workspace was
--   created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataSources:WorkspaceDescription'</a>,
--   <a>workspaceDescription_dataSources</a> - Specifies the Amazon Web
--   Services data sources that have been configured to have IAM roles and
--   permissions created to allow Amazon Managed Grafana to read data from
--   these sources.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpoint:WorkspaceDescription'</a>,
--   <a>workspaceDescription_endpoint</a> - The URL that users can use to
--   access the Grafana console in the workspace.
--   
--   <a>$sel:grafanaVersion:WorkspaceDescription'</a>,
--   <a>workspaceDescription_grafanaVersion</a> - The version of Grafana
--   supported in this workspace.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:WorkspaceDescription'</a>, <a>workspaceDescription_id</a> -
--   The unique ID of this workspace.
--   
--   <a>$sel:modified:WorkspaceDescription'</a>,
--   <a>workspaceDescription_modified</a> - The most recent date that the
--   workspace was modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:WorkspaceDescription'</a>,
--   <a>workspaceDescription_status</a> - The current status of the
--   workspace.
newWorkspaceDescription :: AuthenticationSummary -> UTCTime -> Text -> Text -> Text -> UTCTime -> WorkspaceStatus -> WorkspaceDescription

-- | The IAM role that grants permissions to the Amazon Web Services
--   resources that the workspace will view data from. This role must
--   already exist.
workspaceDescription_workspaceRoleArn :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | If this workspace is currently in the free trial period for Grafana
--   Enterprise, this value specifies when that free trial ends.
workspaceDescription_freeTrialExpiration :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Specifies whether this workspace has a full Grafana Enterprise license
--   or a free trial license.
workspaceDescription_licenseType :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription (Maybe LicenseType)

-- | If this is <tt>Service Managed</tt>, Amazon Managed Grafana
--   automatically creates the IAM roles and provisions the permissions
--   that the workspace needs to use Amazon Web Services data sources and
--   notification channels.
--   
--   If this is <tt>CUSTOMER_MANAGED</tt>, you manage those roles and
--   permissions yourself. If you are creating this workspace in a member
--   account of an organization and that account is not a delegated
--   administrator account, and you want the workspace to access data
--   sources in other Amazon Web Services accounts in the organization, you
--   must choose <tt>CUSTOMER_MANAGED</tt>.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Amazon Managed Grafana permissions and
--   policies for Amazon Web Services data sources and notification
--   channels</a>
workspaceDescription_permissionType :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription (Maybe PermissionType)

-- | The name of the workspace.
workspaceDescription_name :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Web Services notification channels that Amazon Managed
--   Grafana can automatically create IAM roles and permissions for, to
--   allow Amazon Managed Grafana to use these channels.
workspaceDescription_notificationDestinations :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription (Maybe [NotificationDestinationType])

-- | Specifies whether the workspace can access Amazon Web Services
--   resources in this Amazon Web Services account only, or whether it can
--   also access Amazon Web Services resources in other accounts in the
--   same organization. If this is <tt>ORGANIZATION</tt>, the
--   <tt>workspaceOrganizationalUnits</tt> parameter specifies which
--   organizational units the workspace can access.
workspaceDescription_accountAccessType :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription (Maybe AccountAccessType)

-- | If this workspace has a full Grafana Enterprise license, this
--   specifies when the license ends and will need to be renewed.
workspaceDescription_licenseExpiration :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The name of the IAM role that is used to access resources through
--   Organizations.
workspaceDescription_organizationRoleName :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the CloudFormation stack set that is used to generate IAM
--   roles to be used for this workspace.
workspaceDescription_stackSetName :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the organizational units that this workspace is allowed to
--   use data sources from, if this workspace is in an account that is part
--   of an organization.
workspaceDescription_organizationalUnits :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription (Maybe [Text])

-- | The user-defined description of the workspace.
workspaceDescription_description :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether this workspace has already fully used its free trial
--   for Grafana Enterprise.
workspaceDescription_freeTrialConsumed :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription (Maybe Bool)

-- | A structure that describes whether the workspace uses SAML, Amazon Web
--   Services SSO, or both methods for user authentication.
workspaceDescription_authentication :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription AuthenticationSummary

-- | The date that the workspace was created.
workspaceDescription_created :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription UTCTime

-- | Specifies the Amazon Web Services data sources that have been
--   configured to have IAM roles and permissions created to allow Amazon
--   Managed Grafana to read data from these sources.
workspaceDescription_dataSources :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription [DataSourceType]

-- | The URL that users can use to access the Grafana console in the
--   workspace.
workspaceDescription_endpoint :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription Text

-- | The version of Grafana supported in this workspace.
workspaceDescription_grafanaVersion :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription Text

-- | The unique ID of this workspace.
workspaceDescription_id :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription Text

-- | The most recent date that the workspace was modified.
workspaceDescription_modified :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription UTCTime

-- | The current status of the workspace.
workspaceDescription_status :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription WorkspaceStatus
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Grafana.Types.WorkspaceDescription.WorkspaceDescription
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Grafana.Types.WorkspaceDescription.WorkspaceDescription
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Grafana.Types.WorkspaceDescription.WorkspaceDescription
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.Grafana.Types.WorkspaceDescription.WorkspaceDescription
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.Grafana.Types.WorkspaceDescription.WorkspaceDescription
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Grafana.Types.WorkspaceDescription.WorkspaceDescription


module Amazonka.Grafana.Types.WorkspaceSummary

-- | A structure that contains some information about one workspace in the
--   account.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWorkspaceSummary</a> smart constructor.
data WorkspaceSummary
WorkspaceSummary' :: Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe [NotificationDestinationType] -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> AuthenticationSummary -> POSIX -> Text -> Text -> Text -> POSIX -> WorkspaceStatus -> WorkspaceSummary

-- | The name of the workspace.
[$sel:name:WorkspaceSummary'] :: WorkspaceSummary -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | The Amazon Web Services notification channels that Amazon Managed
--   Grafana can automatically create IAM roles and permissions for, which
--   allows Amazon Managed Grafana to use these channels.
[$sel:notificationDestinations:WorkspaceSummary'] :: WorkspaceSummary -> Maybe [NotificationDestinationType]

-- | The customer-entered description of the workspace.
[$sel:description:WorkspaceSummary'] :: WorkspaceSummary -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | A structure containing information about the authentication methods
--   used in the workspace.
[$sel:authentication:WorkspaceSummary'] :: WorkspaceSummary -> AuthenticationSummary

-- | The date that the workspace was created.
[$sel:created:WorkspaceSummary'] :: WorkspaceSummary -> POSIX

-- | The URL endpoint to use to access the Grafana console in the
--   workspace.
[$sel:endpoint:WorkspaceSummary'] :: WorkspaceSummary -> Text

-- | The Grafana version that the workspace is running.
[$sel:grafanaVersion:WorkspaceSummary'] :: WorkspaceSummary -> Text

-- | The unique ID of the workspace.
[$sel:id:WorkspaceSummary'] :: WorkspaceSummary -> Text

-- | The most recent date that the workspace was modified.
[$sel:modified:WorkspaceSummary'] :: WorkspaceSummary -> POSIX

-- | The current status of the workspace.
[$sel:status:WorkspaceSummary'] :: WorkspaceSummary -> WorkspaceStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>WorkspaceSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:WorkspaceSummary'</a>, <a>workspaceSummary_name</a> - The
--   name of the workspace.
--   
--   <a>$sel:notificationDestinations:WorkspaceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>workspaceSummary_notificationDestinations</a> - The Amazon Web
--   Services notification channels that Amazon Managed Grafana can
--   automatically create IAM roles and permissions for, which allows
--   Amazon Managed Grafana to use these channels.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:WorkspaceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>workspaceSummary_description</a> - The customer-entered description
--   of the workspace.
--   
--   <a>$sel:authentication:WorkspaceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>workspaceSummary_authentication</a> - A structure containing
--   information about the authentication methods used in the workspace.
--   
--   <a>$sel:created:WorkspaceSummary'</a>, <a>workspaceSummary_created</a>
--   - The date that the workspace was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpoint:WorkspaceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>workspaceSummary_endpoint</a> - The URL endpoint to use to access
--   the Grafana console in the workspace.
--   
--   <a>$sel:grafanaVersion:WorkspaceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>workspaceSummary_grafanaVersion</a> - The Grafana version that the
--   workspace is running.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:WorkspaceSummary'</a>, <a>workspaceSummary_id</a> - The
--   unique ID of the workspace.
--   
--   <a>$sel:modified:WorkspaceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>workspaceSummary_modified</a> - The most recent date that the
--   workspace was modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:WorkspaceSummary'</a>, <a>workspaceSummary_status</a> -
--   The current status of the workspace.
newWorkspaceSummary :: AuthenticationSummary -> UTCTime -> Text -> Text -> Text -> UTCTime -> WorkspaceStatus -> WorkspaceSummary

-- | The name of the workspace.
workspaceSummary_name :: Lens' WorkspaceSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Web Services notification channels that Amazon Managed
--   Grafana can automatically create IAM roles and permissions for, which
--   allows Amazon Managed Grafana to use these channels.
workspaceSummary_notificationDestinations :: Lens' WorkspaceSummary (Maybe [NotificationDestinationType])

-- | The customer-entered description of the workspace.
workspaceSummary_description :: Lens' WorkspaceSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | A structure containing information about the authentication methods
--   used in the workspace.
workspaceSummary_authentication :: Lens' WorkspaceSummary AuthenticationSummary

-- | The date that the workspace was created.
workspaceSummary_created :: Lens' WorkspaceSummary UTCTime

-- | The URL endpoint to use to access the Grafana console in the
--   workspace.
workspaceSummary_endpoint :: Lens' WorkspaceSummary Text

-- | The Grafana version that the workspace is running.
workspaceSummary_grafanaVersion :: Lens' WorkspaceSummary Text

-- | The unique ID of the workspace.
workspaceSummary_id :: Lens' WorkspaceSummary Text

-- | The most recent date that the workspace was modified.
workspaceSummary_modified :: Lens' WorkspaceSummary UTCTime

-- | The current status of the workspace.
workspaceSummary_status :: Lens' WorkspaceSummary WorkspaceStatus
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Grafana.Types.WorkspaceSummary.WorkspaceSummary
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Grafana.Types.WorkspaceSummary.WorkspaceSummary
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Grafana.Types.WorkspaceSummary.WorkspaceSummary
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.Grafana.Types.WorkspaceSummary.WorkspaceSummary
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.Grafana.Types.WorkspaceSummary.WorkspaceSummary
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Grafana.Types.WorkspaceSummary.WorkspaceSummary


module Amazonka.Grafana.Types

-- | API version <tt>2020-08-18</tt> of the Amazon Managed Grafana SDK
--   configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | The value of a parameter in the request caused an error.
_ValidationException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You do not have sufficient permissions to perform this action.
_AccessDeniedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | A resource was in an inconsistent state during an update or a
--   deletion.
_ConflictException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request would cause a service quota to be exceeded.
_ServiceQuotaExceededException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request was denied because of request throttling. Retry the
--   request.
_ThrottlingException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Unexpected error while processing the request. Retry the request.
_InternalServerException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request references a resource that does not exist.
_ResourceNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError
newtype AccountAccessType
AccountAccessType' :: Text -> AccountAccessType
[fromAccountAccessType] :: AccountAccessType -> Text
pattern AccountAccessType_CURRENT_ACCOUNT :: AccountAccessType
pattern AccountAccessType_ORGANIZATION :: AccountAccessType
newtype AuthenticationProviderTypes
AuthenticationProviderTypes' :: Text -> AuthenticationProviderTypes
[fromAuthenticationProviderTypes] :: AuthenticationProviderTypes -> Text
pattern AuthenticationProviderTypes_AWS_SSO :: AuthenticationProviderTypes
pattern AuthenticationProviderTypes_SAML :: AuthenticationProviderTypes
newtype DataSourceType
DataSourceType' :: Text -> DataSourceType
[fromDataSourceType] :: DataSourceType -> Text
pattern DataSourceType_AMAZON_OPENSEARCH_SERVICE :: DataSourceType
pattern DataSourceType_CLOUDWATCH :: DataSourceType
pattern DataSourceType_PROMETHEUS :: DataSourceType
pattern DataSourceType_SITEWISE :: DataSourceType
pattern DataSourceType_TIMESTREAM :: DataSourceType
pattern DataSourceType_XRAY :: DataSourceType
newtype LicenseType
LicenseType' :: Text -> LicenseType
[fromLicenseType] :: LicenseType -> Text
pattern LicenseType_ENTERPRISE :: LicenseType
pattern LicenseType_ENTERPRISE_FREE_TRIAL :: LicenseType
newtype NotificationDestinationType
NotificationDestinationType' :: Text -> NotificationDestinationType
[fromNotificationDestinationType] :: NotificationDestinationType -> Text
pattern NotificationDestinationType_SNS :: NotificationDestinationType
newtype PermissionType
PermissionType' :: Text -> PermissionType
[fromPermissionType] :: PermissionType -> Text
pattern PermissionType_CUSTOMER_MANAGED :: PermissionType
pattern PermissionType_SERVICE_MANAGED :: PermissionType
newtype Role
Role' :: Text -> Role
[fromRole] :: Role -> Text
pattern Role_ADMIN :: Role
pattern Role_EDITOR :: Role
newtype SamlConfigurationStatus
SamlConfigurationStatus' :: Text -> SamlConfigurationStatus
[fromSamlConfigurationStatus] :: SamlConfigurationStatus -> Text
pattern SamlConfigurationStatus_CONFIGURED :: SamlConfigurationStatus
pattern SamlConfigurationStatus_NOT_CONFIGURED :: SamlConfigurationStatus
newtype UpdateAction
UpdateAction' :: Text -> UpdateAction
[fromUpdateAction] :: UpdateAction -> Text
pattern UpdateAction_ADD :: UpdateAction
pattern UpdateAction_REVOKE :: UpdateAction
newtype UserType
UserType' :: Text -> UserType
[fromUserType] :: UserType -> Text
pattern UserType_SSO_GROUP :: UserType
pattern UserType_SSO_USER :: UserType
newtype WorkspaceStatus
WorkspaceStatus' :: Text -> WorkspaceStatus
[fromWorkspaceStatus] :: WorkspaceStatus -> Text
pattern WorkspaceStatus_ACTIVE :: WorkspaceStatus
pattern WorkspaceStatus_CREATING :: WorkspaceStatus
pattern WorkspaceStatus_CREATION_FAILED :: WorkspaceStatus
pattern WorkspaceStatus_DELETING :: WorkspaceStatus
pattern WorkspaceStatus_DELETION_FAILED :: WorkspaceStatus
pattern WorkspaceStatus_FAILED :: WorkspaceStatus
pattern WorkspaceStatus_LICENSE_REMOVAL_FAILED :: WorkspaceStatus
pattern WorkspaceStatus_UPDATE_FAILED :: WorkspaceStatus
pattern WorkspaceStatus_UPDATING :: WorkspaceStatus
pattern WorkspaceStatus_UPGRADE_FAILED :: WorkspaceStatus
pattern WorkspaceStatus_UPGRADING :: WorkspaceStatus

-- | A structure that defines which attributes in the IdP assertion are to
--   be used to define information about the users authenticated by the IdP
--   to use the workspace.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAssertionAttributes</a> smart constructor.
data AssertionAttributes
AssertionAttributes' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> AssertionAttributes

-- | The name of the attribute within the SAML assertion to use as the
--   email names for SAML users.
[$sel:email:AssertionAttributes'] :: AssertionAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the attribute within the SAML assertion to use as the user
--   full "friendly" names for user groups.
[$sel:groups:AssertionAttributes'] :: AssertionAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the attribute within the SAML assertion to use as the user
--   full "friendly" names for the users' organizations.
[$sel:org:AssertionAttributes'] :: AssertionAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the attribute within the SAML assertion to use as the user
--   roles.
[$sel:role':AssertionAttributes'] :: AssertionAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the attribute within the SAML assertion to use as the user
--   full "friendly" names for SAML users.
[$sel:name:AssertionAttributes'] :: AssertionAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the attribute within the SAML assertion to use as the
--   login names for SAML users.
[$sel:login:AssertionAttributes'] :: AssertionAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AssertionAttributes</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:email:AssertionAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>assertionAttributes_email</a> - The name of the attribute within
--   the SAML assertion to use as the email names for SAML users.
--   
--   <a>$sel:groups:AssertionAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>assertionAttributes_groups</a> - The name of the attribute within
--   the SAML assertion to use as the user full "friendly" names for user
--   groups.
--   
--   <a>$sel:org:AssertionAttributes'</a>, <a>assertionAttributes_org</a> -
--   The name of the attribute within the SAML assertion to use as the user
--   full "friendly" names for the users' organizations.
--   
--   <a>$sel:role':AssertionAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>assertionAttributes_role</a> - The name of the attribute within the
--   SAML assertion to use as the user roles.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:AssertionAttributes'</a>, <a>assertionAttributes_name</a>
--   - The name of the attribute within the SAML assertion to use as the
--   user full "friendly" names for SAML users.
--   
--   <a>$sel:login:AssertionAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>assertionAttributes_login</a> - The name of the attribute within
--   the SAML assertion to use as the login names for SAML users.
newAssertionAttributes :: AssertionAttributes

-- | The name of the attribute within the SAML assertion to use as the
--   email names for SAML users.
assertionAttributes_email :: Lens' AssertionAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the attribute within the SAML assertion to use as the user
--   full "friendly" names for user groups.
assertionAttributes_groups :: Lens' AssertionAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the attribute within the SAML assertion to use as the user
--   full "friendly" names for the users' organizations.
assertionAttributes_org :: Lens' AssertionAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the attribute within the SAML assertion to use as the user
--   roles.
assertionAttributes_role :: Lens' AssertionAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the attribute within the SAML assertion to use as the user
--   full "friendly" names for SAML users.
assertionAttributes_name :: Lens' AssertionAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the attribute within the SAML assertion to use as the
--   login names for SAML users.
assertionAttributes_login :: Lens' AssertionAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | A structure containing information about the user authentication
--   methods used by the workspace.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAuthenticationDescription</a> smart constructor.
data AuthenticationDescription
AuthenticationDescription' :: Maybe AwsSsoAuthentication -> Maybe SamlAuthentication -> [AuthenticationProviderTypes] -> AuthenticationDescription

-- | A structure containing information about how this workspace works with
--   Amazon Web Services SSO.
[$sel:awsSso:AuthenticationDescription'] :: AuthenticationDescription -> Maybe AwsSsoAuthentication

-- | A structure containing information about how this workspace works with
--   SAML, including what attributes within the assertion are to be mapped
--   to user information in the workspace.
[$sel:saml:AuthenticationDescription'] :: AuthenticationDescription -> Maybe SamlAuthentication

-- | Specifies whether this workspace uses Amazon Web Services SSO, SAML,
--   or both methods to authenticate users to use the Grafana console in
--   the Amazon Managed Grafana workspace.
[$sel:providers:AuthenticationDescription'] :: AuthenticationDescription -> [AuthenticationProviderTypes]

-- | Create a value of <a>AuthenticationDescription</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:awsSso:AuthenticationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>authenticationDescription_awsSso</a> - A structure containing
--   information about how this workspace works with Amazon Web Services
--   SSO.
--   
--   <a>$sel:saml:AuthenticationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>authenticationDescription_saml</a> - A structure containing
--   information about how this workspace works with SAML, including what
--   attributes within the assertion are to be mapped to user information
--   in the workspace.
--   
--   <a>$sel:providers:AuthenticationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>authenticationDescription_providers</a> - Specifies whether this
--   workspace uses Amazon Web Services SSO, SAML, or both methods to
--   authenticate users to use the Grafana console in the Amazon Managed
--   Grafana workspace.
newAuthenticationDescription :: AuthenticationDescription

-- | A structure containing information about how this workspace works with
--   Amazon Web Services SSO.
authenticationDescription_awsSso :: Lens' AuthenticationDescription (Maybe AwsSsoAuthentication)

-- | A structure containing information about how this workspace works with
--   SAML, including what attributes within the assertion are to be mapped
--   to user information in the workspace.
authenticationDescription_saml :: Lens' AuthenticationDescription (Maybe SamlAuthentication)

-- | Specifies whether this workspace uses Amazon Web Services SSO, SAML,
--   or both methods to authenticate users to use the Grafana console in
--   the Amazon Managed Grafana workspace.
authenticationDescription_providers :: Lens' AuthenticationDescription [AuthenticationProviderTypes]

-- | A structure that describes whether the workspace uses SAML, Amazon Web
--   Services SSO, or both methods for user authentication, and whether
--   that authentication is fully configured.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAuthenticationSummary</a> smart constructor.
data AuthenticationSummary
AuthenticationSummary' :: Maybe SamlConfigurationStatus -> [AuthenticationProviderTypes] -> AuthenticationSummary

-- | Specifies whether the workplace's user authentication method is fully
--   configured.
[$sel:samlConfigurationStatus:AuthenticationSummary'] :: AuthenticationSummary -> Maybe SamlConfigurationStatus

-- | Specifies whether the workspace uses SAML, Amazon Web Services SSO, or
--   both methods for user authentication.
[$sel:providers:AuthenticationSummary'] :: AuthenticationSummary -> [AuthenticationProviderTypes]

-- | Create a value of <a>AuthenticationSummary</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:samlConfigurationStatus:AuthenticationSummary'</a>,
--   <a>authenticationSummary_samlConfigurationStatus</a> - Specifies
--   whether the workplace's user authentication method is fully
--   configured.
--   
--   <a>$sel:providers:AuthenticationSummary'</a>,
--   <a>authenticationSummary_providers</a> - Specifies whether the
--   workspace uses SAML, Amazon Web Services SSO, or both methods for user
--   authentication.
newAuthenticationSummary :: AuthenticationSummary

-- | Specifies whether the workplace's user authentication method is fully
--   configured.
authenticationSummary_samlConfigurationStatus :: Lens' AuthenticationSummary (Maybe SamlConfigurationStatus)

-- | Specifies whether the workspace uses SAML, Amazon Web Services SSO, or
--   both methods for user authentication.
authenticationSummary_providers :: Lens' AuthenticationSummary [AuthenticationProviderTypes]

-- | A structure containing information about how this workspace works with
--   Amazon Web Services SSO.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAwsSsoAuthentication</a> smart constructor.
data AwsSsoAuthentication
AwsSsoAuthentication' :: Maybe Text -> AwsSsoAuthentication

-- | The ID of the Amazon Web Services SSO-managed application that is
--   created by Amazon Managed Grafana.
[$sel:ssoClientId:AwsSsoAuthentication'] :: AwsSsoAuthentication -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AwsSsoAuthentication</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:ssoClientId:AwsSsoAuthentication'</a>,
--   <a>awsSsoAuthentication_ssoClientId</a> - The ID of the Amazon Web
--   Services SSO-managed application that is created by Amazon Managed
--   Grafana.
newAwsSsoAuthentication :: AwsSsoAuthentication

-- | The ID of the Amazon Web Services SSO-managed application that is
--   created by Amazon Managed Grafana.
awsSsoAuthentication_ssoClientId :: Lens' AwsSsoAuthentication (Maybe Text)

-- | A structure containing the identity provider (IdP) metadata used to
--   integrate the identity provider with this workspace. You can specify
--   the metadata either by providing a URL to its location in the
--   <tt>url</tt> parameter, or by specifying the full metadata in XML
--   format in the <tt>xml</tt> parameter.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newIdpMetadata</a> smart constructor.
data IdpMetadata
IdpMetadata' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> IdpMetadata

-- | The URL of the location containing the metadata.
[$sel:url:IdpMetadata'] :: IdpMetadata -> Maybe Text

-- | The actual full metadata file, in XML format.
[$sel:xml:IdpMetadata'] :: IdpMetadata -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>IdpMetadata</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:url:IdpMetadata'</a>, <a>idpMetadata_url</a> - The URL of the
--   location containing the metadata.
--   
--   <a>$sel:xml:IdpMetadata'</a>, <a>idpMetadata_xml</a> - The actual full
--   metadata file, in XML format.
newIdpMetadata :: IdpMetadata

-- | The URL of the location containing the metadata.
idpMetadata_url :: Lens' IdpMetadata (Maybe Text)

-- | The actual full metadata file, in XML format.
idpMetadata_xml :: Lens' IdpMetadata (Maybe Text)

-- | A structure containing the identity of one user or group and the
--   <tt>Admin</tt> or <tt>Editor</tt> role that they have.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPermissionEntry</a> smart constructor.
data PermissionEntry
PermissionEntry' :: Role -> User -> PermissionEntry

-- | Specifies whether the user or group has the <tt>Admin</tt> or
--   <tt>Editor</tt> role.
[$sel:role':PermissionEntry'] :: PermissionEntry -> Role

-- | A structure with the ID of the user or group with this role.
[$sel:user:PermissionEntry'] :: PermissionEntry -> User

-- | Create a value of <a>PermissionEntry</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:role':PermissionEntry'</a>, <a>permissionEntry_role</a> -
--   Specifies whether the user or group has the <tt>Admin</tt> or
--   <tt>Editor</tt> role.
--   
--   <a>$sel:user:PermissionEntry'</a>, <a>permissionEntry_user</a> - A
--   structure with the ID of the user or group with this role.
newPermissionEntry :: Role -> User -> PermissionEntry

-- | Specifies whether the user or group has the <tt>Admin</tt> or
--   <tt>Editor</tt> role.
permissionEntry_role :: Lens' PermissionEntry Role

-- | A structure with the ID of the user or group with this role.
permissionEntry_user :: Lens' PermissionEntry User

-- | This structure defines which groups defined in the SAML assertion
--   attribute are to be mapped to the Grafana <tt>Admin</tt> and
--   <tt>Editor</tt> roles in the workspace.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRoleValues</a> smart constructor.
data RoleValues
RoleValues' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> RoleValues

-- | A list of groups from the SAML assertion attribute to grant the
--   Grafana <tt>Admin</tt> role to.
[$sel:admin:RoleValues'] :: RoleValues -> Maybe [Text]

-- | A list of groups from the SAML assertion attribute to grant the
--   Grafana <tt>Editor</tt> role to.
[$sel:editor:RoleValues'] :: RoleValues -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>RoleValues</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:admin:RoleValues'</a>, <a>roleValues_admin</a> - A list of
--   groups from the SAML assertion attribute to grant the Grafana
--   <tt>Admin</tt> role to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:editor:RoleValues'</a>, <a>roleValues_editor</a> - A list of
--   groups from the SAML assertion attribute to grant the Grafana
--   <tt>Editor</tt> role to.
newRoleValues :: RoleValues

-- | A list of groups from the SAML assertion attribute to grant the
--   Grafana <tt>Admin</tt> role to.
roleValues_admin :: Lens' RoleValues (Maybe [Text])

-- | A list of groups from the SAML assertion attribute to grant the
--   Grafana <tt>Editor</tt> role to.
roleValues_editor :: Lens' RoleValues (Maybe [Text])

-- | A structure containing information about how this workspace works with
--   SAML.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSamlAuthentication</a> smart constructor.
data SamlAuthentication
SamlAuthentication' :: Maybe SamlConfiguration -> SamlConfigurationStatus -> SamlAuthentication

-- | A structure containing details about how this workspace works with
--   SAML.
[$sel:configuration:SamlAuthentication'] :: SamlAuthentication -> Maybe SamlConfiguration

-- | Specifies whether the workspace's SAML configuration is complete.
[$sel:status:SamlAuthentication'] :: SamlAuthentication -> SamlConfigurationStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>SamlAuthentication</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:configuration:SamlAuthentication'</a>,
--   <a>samlAuthentication_configuration</a> - A structure containing
--   details about how this workspace works with SAML.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:SamlAuthentication'</a>,
--   <a>samlAuthentication_status</a> - Specifies whether the workspace's
--   SAML configuration is complete.
newSamlAuthentication :: SamlConfigurationStatus -> SamlAuthentication

-- | A structure containing details about how this workspace works with
--   SAML.
samlAuthentication_configuration :: Lens' SamlAuthentication (Maybe SamlConfiguration)

-- | Specifies whether the workspace's SAML configuration is complete.
samlAuthentication_status :: Lens' SamlAuthentication SamlConfigurationStatus

-- | A structure containing information about how this workspace works with
--   SAML.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSamlConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data SamlConfiguration
SamlConfiguration' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe AssertionAttributes -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe RoleValues -> IdpMetadata -> SamlConfiguration

-- | How long a sign-on session by a SAML user is valid, before the user
--   has to sign on again.
[$sel:loginValidityDuration:SamlConfiguration'] :: SamlConfiguration -> Maybe Int

-- | A structure that defines which attributes in the SAML assertion are to
--   be used to define information about the users authenticated by that
--   IdP to use the workspace.
[$sel:assertionAttributes:SamlConfiguration'] :: SamlConfiguration -> Maybe AssertionAttributes

-- | Lists which organizations defined in the SAML assertion are allowed to
--   use the Amazon Managed Grafana workspace. If this is empty, all
--   organizations in the assertion attribute have access.
[$sel:allowedOrganizations:SamlConfiguration'] :: SamlConfiguration -> Maybe [Text]

-- | A structure containing arrays that map group names in the SAML
--   assertion to the Grafana <tt>Admin</tt> and <tt>Editor</tt> roles in
--   the workspace.
[$sel:roleValues:SamlConfiguration'] :: SamlConfiguration -> Maybe RoleValues

-- | A structure containing the identity provider (IdP) metadata used to
--   integrate the identity provider with this workspace.
[$sel:idpMetadata:SamlConfiguration'] :: SamlConfiguration -> IdpMetadata

-- | Create a value of <a>SamlConfiguration</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:loginValidityDuration:SamlConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>samlConfiguration_loginValidityDuration</a> - How long a sign-on
--   session by a SAML user is valid, before the user has to sign on again.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assertionAttributes:SamlConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>samlConfiguration_assertionAttributes</a> - A structure that
--   defines which attributes in the SAML assertion are to be used to
--   define information about the users authenticated by that IdP to use
--   the workspace.
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowedOrganizations:SamlConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>samlConfiguration_allowedOrganizations</a> - Lists which
--   organizations defined in the SAML assertion are allowed to use the
