--   Amazon Managed Grafana workspace. If this is empty, all organizations
--   in the assertion attribute have access.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleValues:SamlConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>samlConfiguration_roleValues</a> - A structure containing arrays
--   that map group names in the SAML assertion to the Grafana
--   <tt>Admin</tt> and <tt>Editor</tt> roles in the workspace.
--   
--   <a>$sel:idpMetadata:SamlConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>samlConfiguration_idpMetadata</a> - A structure containing the
--   identity provider (IdP) metadata used to integrate the identity
--   provider with this workspace.
newSamlConfiguration :: IdpMetadata -> SamlConfiguration

-- | How long a sign-on session by a SAML user is valid, before the user
--   has to sign on again.
samlConfiguration_loginValidityDuration :: Lens' SamlConfiguration (Maybe Int)

-- | A structure that defines which attributes in the SAML assertion are to
--   be used to define information about the users authenticated by that
--   IdP to use the workspace.
samlConfiguration_assertionAttributes :: Lens' SamlConfiguration (Maybe AssertionAttributes)

-- | Lists which organizations defined in the SAML assertion are allowed to
--   use the Amazon Managed Grafana workspace. If this is empty, all
--   organizations in the assertion attribute have access.
samlConfiguration_allowedOrganizations :: Lens' SamlConfiguration (Maybe [Text])

-- | A structure containing arrays that map group names in the SAML
--   assertion to the Grafana <tt>Admin</tt> and <tt>Editor</tt> roles in
--   the workspace.
samlConfiguration_roleValues :: Lens' SamlConfiguration (Maybe RoleValues)

-- | A structure containing the identity provider (IdP) metadata used to
--   integrate the identity provider with this workspace.
samlConfiguration_idpMetadata :: Lens' SamlConfiguration IdpMetadata

-- | A structure containing information about one error encountered while
--   performing an <a>UpdatePermissions</a> operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateError</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateError
UpdateError' :: UpdateInstruction -> Natural -> Text -> UpdateError

-- | Specifies which permission update caused the error.
[$sel:causedBy:UpdateError'] :: UpdateError -> UpdateInstruction

-- | The error code.
[$sel:code:UpdateError'] :: UpdateError -> Natural

-- | The message for this error.
[$sel:message:UpdateError'] :: UpdateError -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateError</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:causedBy:UpdateError'</a>, <a>updateError_causedBy</a> -
--   Specifies which permission update caused the error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:code:UpdateError'</a>, <a>updateError_code</a> - The error
--   code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:message:UpdateError'</a>, <a>updateError_message</a> - The
--   message for this error.
newUpdateError :: UpdateInstruction -> Natural -> Text -> UpdateError

-- | Specifies which permission update caused the error.
updateError_causedBy :: Lens' UpdateError UpdateInstruction

-- | The error code.
updateError_code :: Lens' UpdateError Natural

-- | The message for this error.
updateError_message :: Lens' UpdateError Text

-- | Contains the instructions for one Grafana role permission update in a
--   <a>UpdatePermissions</a> operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateInstruction</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateInstruction
UpdateInstruction' :: UpdateAction -> Role -> [User] -> UpdateInstruction

-- | Specifies whether this update is to add or revoke role permissions.
[$sel:action:UpdateInstruction'] :: UpdateInstruction -> UpdateAction

-- | The role to add or revoke for the user or the group specified in
--   <tt>users</tt>.
[$sel:role':UpdateInstruction'] :: UpdateInstruction -> Role

-- | A structure that specifies the user or group to add or revoke the role
--   for.
[$sel:users:UpdateInstruction'] :: UpdateInstruction -> [User]

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateInstruction</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:action:UpdateInstruction'</a>, <a>updateInstruction_action</a>
--   - Specifies whether this update is to add or revoke role permissions.
--   
--   <a>$sel:role':UpdateInstruction'</a>, <a>updateInstruction_role</a> -
--   The role to add or revoke for the user or the group specified in
--   <tt>users</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:users:UpdateInstruction'</a>, <a>updateInstruction_users</a> -
--   A structure that specifies the user or group to add or revoke the role
--   for.
newUpdateInstruction :: UpdateAction -> Role -> UpdateInstruction

-- | Specifies whether this update is to add or revoke role permissions.
updateInstruction_action :: Lens' UpdateInstruction UpdateAction

-- | The role to add or revoke for the user or the group specified in
--   <tt>users</tt>.
updateInstruction_role :: Lens' UpdateInstruction Role

-- | A structure that specifies the user or group to add or revoke the role
--   for.
updateInstruction_users :: Lens' UpdateInstruction [User]

-- | A structure that specifies one user or group in the workspace.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUser</a> smart constructor.
data User
User' :: Text -> UserType -> User

-- | The ID of the user or group.
[$sel:id:User'] :: User -> Text

-- | Specifies whether this is a single user or a group.
[$sel:type':User'] :: User -> UserType

-- | Create a value of <a>User</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:User'</a>, <a>user_id</a> - The ID of the user or group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':User'</a>, <a>user_type</a> - Specifies whether this is
--   a single user or a group.
newUser :: Text -> UserType -> User

-- | The ID of the user or group.
user_id :: Lens' User Text

-- | Specifies whether this is a single user or a group.
user_type :: Lens' User UserType

-- | A structure containing information about an Amazon Managed Grafana
--   workspace in your account.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWorkspaceDescription</a> smart constructor.
data WorkspaceDescription
WorkspaceDescription' :: Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe LicenseType -> Maybe PermissionType -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe [NotificationDestinationType] -> Maybe AccountAccessType -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (Sensitive [Text]) -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe Bool -> AuthenticationSummary -> POSIX -> [DataSourceType] -> Text -> Text -> Text -> POSIX -> WorkspaceStatus -> WorkspaceDescription

-- | The IAM role that grants permissions to the Amazon Web Services
--   resources that the workspace will view data from. This role must
--   already exist.
[$sel:workspaceRoleArn:WorkspaceDescription'] :: WorkspaceDescription -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | If this workspace is currently in the free trial period for Grafana
--   Enterprise, this value specifies when that free trial ends.
[$sel:freeTrialExpiration:WorkspaceDescription'] :: WorkspaceDescription -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Specifies whether this workspace has a full Grafana Enterprise license
--   or a free trial license.
[$sel:licenseType:WorkspaceDescription'] :: WorkspaceDescription -> Maybe LicenseType

-- | If this is <tt>Service Managed</tt>, Amazon Managed Grafana
--   automatically creates the IAM roles and provisions the permissions
--   that the workspace needs to use Amazon Web Services data sources and
--   notification channels.
--   
--   If this is <tt>CUSTOMER_MANAGED</tt>, you manage those roles and
--   permissions yourself. If you are creating this workspace in a member
--   account of an organization and that account is not a delegated
--   administrator account, and you want the workspace to access data
--   sources in other Amazon Web Services accounts in the organization, you
--   must choose <tt>CUSTOMER_MANAGED</tt>.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Amazon Managed Grafana permissions and
--   policies for Amazon Web Services data sources and notification
--   channels</a>
[$sel:permissionType:WorkspaceDescription'] :: WorkspaceDescription -> Maybe PermissionType

-- | The name of the workspace.
[$sel:name:WorkspaceDescription'] :: WorkspaceDescription -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | The Amazon Web Services notification channels that Amazon Managed
--   Grafana can automatically create IAM roles and permissions for, to
--   allow Amazon Managed Grafana to use these channels.
[$sel:notificationDestinations:WorkspaceDescription'] :: WorkspaceDescription -> Maybe [NotificationDestinationType]

-- | Specifies whether the workspace can access Amazon Web Services
--   resources in this Amazon Web Services account only, or whether it can
--   also access Amazon Web Services resources in other accounts in the
--   same organization. If this is <tt>ORGANIZATION</tt>, the
--   <tt>workspaceOrganizationalUnits</tt> parameter specifies which
--   organizational units the workspace can access.
[$sel:accountAccessType:WorkspaceDescription'] :: WorkspaceDescription -> Maybe AccountAccessType

-- | If this workspace has a full Grafana Enterprise license, this
--   specifies when the license ends and will need to be renewed.
[$sel:licenseExpiration:WorkspaceDescription'] :: WorkspaceDescription -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The name of the IAM role that is used to access resources through
--   Organizations.
[$sel:organizationRoleName:WorkspaceDescription'] :: WorkspaceDescription -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | The name of the CloudFormation stack set that is used to generate IAM
--   roles to be used for this workspace.
[$sel:stackSetName:WorkspaceDescription'] :: WorkspaceDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the organizational units that this workspace is allowed to
--   use data sources from, if this workspace is in an account that is part
--   of an organization.
[$sel:organizationalUnits:WorkspaceDescription'] :: WorkspaceDescription -> Maybe (Sensitive [Text])

-- | The user-defined description of the workspace.
[$sel:description:WorkspaceDescription'] :: WorkspaceDescription -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | Specifies whether this workspace has already fully used its free trial
--   for Grafana Enterprise.
[$sel:freeTrialConsumed:WorkspaceDescription'] :: WorkspaceDescription -> Maybe Bool

-- | A structure that describes whether the workspace uses SAML, Amazon Web
--   Services SSO, or both methods for user authentication.
[$sel:authentication:WorkspaceDescription'] :: WorkspaceDescription -> AuthenticationSummary

-- | The date that the workspace was created.
[$sel:created:WorkspaceDescription'] :: WorkspaceDescription -> POSIX

-- | Specifies the Amazon Web Services data sources that have been
--   configured to have IAM roles and permissions created to allow Amazon
--   Managed Grafana to read data from these sources.
[$sel:dataSources:WorkspaceDescription'] :: WorkspaceDescription -> [DataSourceType]

-- | The URL that users can use to access the Grafana console in the
--   workspace.
[$sel:endpoint:WorkspaceDescription'] :: WorkspaceDescription -> Text

-- | The version of Grafana supported in this workspace.
[$sel:grafanaVersion:WorkspaceDescription'] :: WorkspaceDescription -> Text

-- | The unique ID of this workspace.
[$sel:id:WorkspaceDescription'] :: WorkspaceDescription -> Text

-- | The most recent date that the workspace was modified.
[$sel:modified:WorkspaceDescription'] :: WorkspaceDescription -> POSIX

-- | The current status of the workspace.
[$sel:status:WorkspaceDescription'] :: WorkspaceDescription -> WorkspaceStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>WorkspaceDescription</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:workspaceRoleArn:WorkspaceDescription'</a>,
--   <a>workspaceDescription_workspaceRoleArn</a> - The IAM role that
--   grants permissions to the Amazon Web Services resources that the
--   workspace will view data from. This role must already exist.
--   
--   <a>$sel:freeTrialExpiration:WorkspaceDescription'</a>,
--   <a>workspaceDescription_freeTrialExpiration</a> - If this workspace is
--   currently in the free trial period for Grafana Enterprise, this value
--   specifies when that free trial ends.
--   
--   <a>$sel:licenseType:WorkspaceDescription'</a>,
--   <a>workspaceDescription_licenseType</a> - Specifies whether this
--   workspace has a full Grafana Enterprise license or a free trial
--   license.
--   
--   <a>$sel:permissionType:WorkspaceDescription'</a>,
--   <a>workspaceDescription_permissionType</a> - If this is <tt>Service
--   Managed</tt>, Amazon Managed Grafana automatically creates the IAM
--   roles and provisions the permissions that the workspace needs to use
--   Amazon Web Services data sources and notification channels.
--   
--   If this is <tt>CUSTOMER_MANAGED</tt>, you manage those roles and
--   permissions yourself. If you are creating this workspace in a member
--   account of an organization and that account is not a delegated
--   administrator account, and you want the workspace to access data
--   sources in other Amazon Web Services accounts in the organization, you
--   must choose <tt>CUSTOMER_MANAGED</tt>.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Amazon Managed Grafana permissions and
--   policies for Amazon Web Services data sources and notification
--   channels</a>
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:WorkspaceDescription'</a>,
--   <a>workspaceDescription_name</a> - The name of the workspace.
--   
--   <a>$sel:notificationDestinations:WorkspaceDescription'</a>,
--   <a>workspaceDescription_notificationDestinations</a> - The Amazon Web
--   Services notification channels that Amazon Managed Grafana can
--   automatically create IAM roles and permissions for, to allow Amazon
--   Managed Grafana to use these channels.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountAccessType:WorkspaceDescription'</a>,
--   <a>workspaceDescription_accountAccessType</a> - Specifies whether the
--   workspace can access Amazon Web Services resources in this Amazon Web
--   Services account only, or whether it can also access Amazon Web
--   Services resources in other accounts in the same organization. If this
--   is <tt>ORGANIZATION</tt>, the <tt>workspaceOrganizationalUnits</tt>
--   parameter specifies which organizational units the workspace can
--   access.
--   
--   <a>$sel:licenseExpiration:WorkspaceDescription'</a>,
--   <a>workspaceDescription_licenseExpiration</a> - If this workspace has
--   a full Grafana Enterprise license, this specifies when the license
--   ends and will need to be renewed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:organizationRoleName:WorkspaceDescription'</a>,
--   <a>workspaceDescription_organizationRoleName</a> - The name of the IAM
--   role that is used to access resources through Organizations.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackSetName:WorkspaceDescription'</a>,
--   <a>workspaceDescription_stackSetName</a> - The name of the
--   CloudFormation stack set that is used to generate IAM roles to be used
--   for this workspace.
--   
--   <a>$sel:organizationalUnits:WorkspaceDescription'</a>,
--   <a>workspaceDescription_organizationalUnits</a> - Specifies the
--   organizational units that this workspace is allowed to use data
--   sources from, if this workspace is in an account that is part of an
--   organization.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:WorkspaceDescription'</a>,
--   <a>workspaceDescription_description</a> - The user-defined description
--   of the workspace.
--   
--   <a>$sel:freeTrialConsumed:WorkspaceDescription'</a>,
--   <a>workspaceDescription_freeTrialConsumed</a> - Specifies whether this
--   workspace has already fully used its free trial for Grafana
--   Enterprise.
--   
--   <a>$sel:authentication:WorkspaceDescription'</a>,
--   <a>workspaceDescription_authentication</a> - A structure that
--   describes whether the workspace uses SAML, Amazon Web Services SSO, or
--   both methods for user authentication.
--   
--   <a>$sel:created:WorkspaceDescription'</a>,
--   <a>workspaceDescription_created</a> - The date that the workspace was
--   created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataSources:WorkspaceDescription'</a>,
--   <a>workspaceDescription_dataSources</a> - Specifies the Amazon Web
--   Services data sources that have been configured to have IAM roles and
--   permissions created to allow Amazon Managed Grafana to read data from
--   these sources.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpoint:WorkspaceDescription'</a>,
--   <a>workspaceDescription_endpoint</a> - The URL that users can use to
--   access the Grafana console in the workspace.
--   
--   <a>$sel:grafanaVersion:WorkspaceDescription'</a>,
--   <a>workspaceDescription_grafanaVersion</a> - The version of Grafana
--   supported in this workspace.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:WorkspaceDescription'</a>, <a>workspaceDescription_id</a> -
--   The unique ID of this workspace.
--   
--   <a>$sel:modified:WorkspaceDescription'</a>,
--   <a>workspaceDescription_modified</a> - The most recent date that the
--   workspace was modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:WorkspaceDescription'</a>,
--   <a>workspaceDescription_status</a> - The current status of the
--   workspace.
newWorkspaceDescription :: AuthenticationSummary -> UTCTime -> Text -> Text -> Text -> UTCTime -> WorkspaceStatus -> WorkspaceDescription

-- | The IAM role that grants permissions to the Amazon Web Services
--   resources that the workspace will view data from. This role must
--   already exist.
workspaceDescription_workspaceRoleArn :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | If this workspace is currently in the free trial period for Grafana
--   Enterprise, this value specifies when that free trial ends.
workspaceDescription_freeTrialExpiration :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Specifies whether this workspace has a full Grafana Enterprise license
--   or a free trial license.
workspaceDescription_licenseType :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription (Maybe LicenseType)

-- | If this is <tt>Service Managed</tt>, Amazon Managed Grafana
--   automatically creates the IAM roles and provisions the permissions
--   that the workspace needs to use Amazon Web Services data sources and
--   notification channels.
--   
--   If this is <tt>CUSTOMER_MANAGED</tt>, you manage those roles and
--   permissions yourself. If you are creating this workspace in a member
--   account of an organization and that account is not a delegated
--   administrator account, and you want the workspace to access data
--   sources in other Amazon Web Services accounts in the organization, you
--   must choose <tt>CUSTOMER_MANAGED</tt>.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Amazon Managed Grafana permissions and
--   policies for Amazon Web Services data sources and notification
--   channels</a>
workspaceDescription_permissionType :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription (Maybe PermissionType)

-- | The name of the workspace.
workspaceDescription_name :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Web Services notification channels that Amazon Managed
--   Grafana can automatically create IAM roles and permissions for, to
--   allow Amazon Managed Grafana to use these channels.
workspaceDescription_notificationDestinations :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription (Maybe [NotificationDestinationType])

-- | Specifies whether the workspace can access Amazon Web Services
--   resources in this Amazon Web Services account only, or whether it can
--   also access Amazon Web Services resources in other accounts in the
--   same organization. If this is <tt>ORGANIZATION</tt>, the
--   <tt>workspaceOrganizationalUnits</tt> parameter specifies which
--   organizational units the workspace can access.
workspaceDescription_accountAccessType :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription (Maybe AccountAccessType)

-- | If this workspace has a full Grafana Enterprise license, this
--   specifies when the license ends and will need to be renewed.
workspaceDescription_licenseExpiration :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The name of the IAM role that is used to access resources through
--   Organizations.
workspaceDescription_organizationRoleName :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the CloudFormation stack set that is used to generate IAM
--   roles to be used for this workspace.
workspaceDescription_stackSetName :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the organizational units that this workspace is allowed to
--   use data sources from, if this workspace is in an account that is part
--   of an organization.
workspaceDescription_organizationalUnits :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription (Maybe [Text])

-- | The user-defined description of the workspace.
workspaceDescription_description :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether this workspace has already fully used its free trial
--   for Grafana Enterprise.
workspaceDescription_freeTrialConsumed :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription (Maybe Bool)

-- | A structure that describes whether the workspace uses SAML, Amazon Web
--   Services SSO, or both methods for user authentication.
workspaceDescription_authentication :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription AuthenticationSummary

-- | The date that the workspace was created.
workspaceDescription_created :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription UTCTime

-- | Specifies the Amazon Web Services data sources that have been
--   configured to have IAM roles and permissions created to allow Amazon
--   Managed Grafana to read data from these sources.
workspaceDescription_dataSources :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription [DataSourceType]

-- | The URL that users can use to access the Grafana console in the
--   workspace.
workspaceDescription_endpoint :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription Text

-- | The version of Grafana supported in this workspace.
workspaceDescription_grafanaVersion :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription Text

-- | The unique ID of this workspace.
workspaceDescription_id :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription Text

-- | The most recent date that the workspace was modified.
workspaceDescription_modified :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription UTCTime

-- | The current status of the workspace.
workspaceDescription_status :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription WorkspaceStatus

-- | A structure that contains some information about one workspace in the
--   account.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWorkspaceSummary</a> smart constructor.
data WorkspaceSummary
WorkspaceSummary' :: Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe [NotificationDestinationType] -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> AuthenticationSummary -> POSIX -> Text -> Text -> Text -> POSIX -> WorkspaceStatus -> WorkspaceSummary

-- | The name of the workspace.
[$sel:name:WorkspaceSummary'] :: WorkspaceSummary -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | The Amazon Web Services notification channels that Amazon Managed
--   Grafana can automatically create IAM roles and permissions for, which
--   allows Amazon Managed Grafana to use these channels.
[$sel:notificationDestinations:WorkspaceSummary'] :: WorkspaceSummary -> Maybe [NotificationDestinationType]

-- | The customer-entered description of the workspace.
[$sel:description:WorkspaceSummary'] :: WorkspaceSummary -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | A structure containing information about the authentication methods
--   used in the workspace.
[$sel:authentication:WorkspaceSummary'] :: WorkspaceSummary -> AuthenticationSummary

-- | The date that the workspace was created.
[$sel:created:WorkspaceSummary'] :: WorkspaceSummary -> POSIX

-- | The URL endpoint to use to access the Grafana console in the
--   workspace.
[$sel:endpoint:WorkspaceSummary'] :: WorkspaceSummary -> Text

-- | The Grafana version that the workspace is running.
[$sel:grafanaVersion:WorkspaceSummary'] :: WorkspaceSummary -> Text

-- | The unique ID of the workspace.
[$sel:id:WorkspaceSummary'] :: WorkspaceSummary -> Text

-- | The most recent date that the workspace was modified.
[$sel:modified:WorkspaceSummary'] :: WorkspaceSummary -> POSIX

-- | The current status of the workspace.
[$sel:status:WorkspaceSummary'] :: WorkspaceSummary -> WorkspaceStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>WorkspaceSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:WorkspaceSummary'</a>, <a>workspaceSummary_name</a> - The
--   name of the workspace.
--   
--   <a>$sel:notificationDestinations:WorkspaceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>workspaceSummary_notificationDestinations</a> - The Amazon Web
--   Services notification channels that Amazon Managed Grafana can
--   automatically create IAM roles and permissions for, which allows
--   Amazon Managed Grafana to use these channels.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:WorkspaceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>workspaceSummary_description</a> - The customer-entered description
--   of the workspace.
--   
--   <a>$sel:authentication:WorkspaceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>workspaceSummary_authentication</a> - A structure containing
--   information about the authentication methods used in the workspace.
--   
--   <a>$sel:created:WorkspaceSummary'</a>, <a>workspaceSummary_created</a>
--   - The date that the workspace was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpoint:WorkspaceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>workspaceSummary_endpoint</a> - The URL endpoint to use to access
--   the Grafana console in the workspace.
--   
--   <a>$sel:grafanaVersion:WorkspaceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>workspaceSummary_grafanaVersion</a> - The Grafana version that the
--   workspace is running.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:WorkspaceSummary'</a>, <a>workspaceSummary_id</a> - The
--   unique ID of the workspace.
--   
--   <a>$sel:modified:WorkspaceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>workspaceSummary_modified</a> - The most recent date that the
--   workspace was modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:WorkspaceSummary'</a>, <a>workspaceSummary_status</a> -
--   The current status of the workspace.
newWorkspaceSummary :: AuthenticationSummary -> UTCTime -> Text -> Text -> Text -> UTCTime -> WorkspaceStatus -> WorkspaceSummary

-- | The name of the workspace.
workspaceSummary_name :: Lens' WorkspaceSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Web Services notification channels that Amazon Managed
--   Grafana can automatically create IAM roles and permissions for, which
--   allows Amazon Managed Grafana to use these channels.
workspaceSummary_notificationDestinations :: Lens' WorkspaceSummary (Maybe [NotificationDestinationType])

-- | The customer-entered description of the workspace.
workspaceSummary_description :: Lens' WorkspaceSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | A structure containing information about the authentication methods
--   used in the workspace.
workspaceSummary_authentication :: Lens' WorkspaceSummary AuthenticationSummary

-- | The date that the workspace was created.
workspaceSummary_created :: Lens' WorkspaceSummary UTCTime

-- | The URL endpoint to use to access the Grafana console in the
--   workspace.
workspaceSummary_endpoint :: Lens' WorkspaceSummary Text

-- | The Grafana version that the workspace is running.
workspaceSummary_grafanaVersion :: Lens' WorkspaceSummary Text

-- | The unique ID of the workspace.
workspaceSummary_id :: Lens' WorkspaceSummary Text

-- | The most recent date that the workspace was modified.
workspaceSummary_modified :: Lens' WorkspaceSummary UTCTime

-- | The current status of the workspace.
workspaceSummary_status :: Lens' WorkspaceSummary WorkspaceStatus


-- | Returns a list of Amazon Managed Grafana workspaces in the account,
--   with some information about each workspace. For more complete
--   information about one workspace, use <a>DescribeWorkspace</a>.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Amazonka.Grafana.ListWorkspaces

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListWorkspaces</a> smart constructor.
data ListWorkspaces
ListWorkspaces' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> ListWorkspaces

-- | The token for the next set of workspaces to return. (You receive this
--   token from a previous <tt>ListWorkspaces</tt> operation.)
[$sel:nextToken:ListWorkspaces'] :: ListWorkspaces -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of workspaces to include in the results.
[$sel:maxResults:ListWorkspaces'] :: ListWorkspaces -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>ListWorkspaces</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListWorkspaces'</a>, <a>listWorkspaces_nextToken</a>
--   - The token for the next set of workspaces to return. (You receive
--   this token from a previous <tt>ListWorkspaces</tt> operation.)
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListWorkspaces'</a>,
--   <a>listWorkspaces_maxResults</a> - The maximum number of workspaces to
--   include in the results.
newListWorkspaces :: ListWorkspaces

-- | The token for the next set of workspaces to return. (You receive this
--   token from a previous <tt>ListWorkspaces</tt> operation.)
listWorkspaces_nextToken :: Lens' ListWorkspaces (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of workspaces to include in the results.
listWorkspaces_maxResults :: Lens' ListWorkspaces (Maybe Natural)

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListWorkspacesResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ListWorkspacesResponse
ListWorkspacesResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Int -> [WorkspaceSummary] -> ListWorkspacesResponse

-- | The token to use when requesting the next set of workspaces.
[$sel:nextToken:ListWorkspacesResponse'] :: ListWorkspacesResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:ListWorkspacesResponse'] :: ListWorkspacesResponse -> Int

-- | An array of structures that contain some information about the
--   workspaces in the account.
[$sel:workspaces:ListWorkspacesResponse'] :: ListWorkspacesResponse -> [WorkspaceSummary]

-- | Create a value of <a>ListWorkspacesResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListWorkspaces'</a>,
--   <a>listWorkspacesResponse_nextToken</a> - The token to use when
--   requesting the next set of workspaces.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ListWorkspacesResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listWorkspacesResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:workspaces:ListWorkspacesResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listWorkspacesResponse_workspaces</a> - An array of structures that
--   contain some information about the workspaces in the account.
newListWorkspacesResponse :: Int -> ListWorkspacesResponse

-- | The token to use when requesting the next set of workspaces.
listWorkspacesResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ListWorkspacesResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
listWorkspacesResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListWorkspacesResponse Int

-- | An array of structures that contain some information about the
--   workspaces in the account.
listWorkspacesResponse_workspaces :: Lens' ListWorkspacesResponse [WorkspaceSummary]
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Grafana.ListWorkspaces.ListWorkspaces
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Grafana.ListWorkspaces.ListWorkspaces
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.Grafana.ListWorkspaces.ListWorkspaces
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Grafana.ListWorkspaces.ListWorkspaces

instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Grafana.ListWorkspaces.ListWorkspacesResponse
instance Amazonka.Types.AWSRequest Amazonka.Grafana.ListWorkspaces.ListWorkspaces
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Grafana.ListWorkspaces.ListWorkspacesResponse
instance Amazonka.Pager.AWSPager Amazonka.Grafana.ListWorkspaces.ListWorkspaces
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.Grafana.ListWorkspaces.ListWorkspaces
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Grafana.ListWorkspaces.ListWorkspaces
instance Amazonka.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Amazonka.Grafana.ListWorkspaces.ListWorkspaces
instance Amazonka.Data.Path.ToPath Amazonka.Grafana.ListWorkspaces.ListWorkspaces

-- | Lists the users and groups who have the Grafana <tt>Admin</tt> and
--   <tt>Editor</tt> roles in this workspace. If you use this operation
--   without specifying <tt>userId</tt> or <tt>groupId</tt>, the operation
--   returns the roles of all users and groups. If you specify a
--   <tt>userId</tt> or a <tt>groupId</tt>, only the roles for that user or
--   group are returned. If you do this, you can specify only one
--   <tt>userId</tt> or one <tt>groupId</tt>.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Amazonka.Grafana.ListPermissions

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListPermissions</a> smart constructor.
data ListPermissions
ListPermissions' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe UserType -> Text -> ListPermissions

-- | (Optional) Limits the results to only the user that matches this ID.
[$sel:userId:ListPermissions'] :: ListPermissions -> Maybe Text

-- | The token to use when requesting the next set of results. You received
--   this token from a previous <tt>ListPermissions</tt> operation.
[$sel:nextToken:ListPermissions'] :: ListPermissions -> Maybe Text

-- | (Optional) Limits the results to only the group that matches this ID.
[$sel:groupId:ListPermissions'] :: ListPermissions -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of results to include in the response.
[$sel:maxResults:ListPermissions'] :: ListPermissions -> Maybe Natural

-- | (Optional) If you specify <tt>SSO_USER</tt>, then only the permissions
--   of Amazon Web Services SSO users are returned. If you specify
--   <tt>SSO_GROUP</tt>, only the permissions of Amazon Web Services SSO
--   groups are returned.
[$sel:userType:ListPermissions'] :: ListPermissions -> Maybe UserType

-- | The ID of the workspace to list permissions for. This parameter is
--   required.
[$sel:workspaceId:ListPermissions'] :: ListPermissions -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ListPermissions</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:userId:ListPermissions'</a>, <a>listPermissions_userId</a> -
--   (Optional) Limits the results to only the user that matches this ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListPermissions'</a>,
--   <a>listPermissions_nextToken</a> - The token to use when requesting
--   the next set of results. You received this token from a previous
--   <tt>ListPermissions</tt> operation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:groupId:ListPermissions'</a>, <a>listPermissions_groupId</a> -
--   (Optional) Limits the results to only the group that matches this ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListPermissions'</a>,
--   <a>listPermissions_maxResults</a> - The maximum number of results to
--   include in the response.
--   
--   <a>$sel:userType:ListPermissions'</a>, <a>listPermissions_userType</a>
--   - (Optional) If you specify <tt>SSO_USER</tt>, then only the
--   permissions of Amazon Web Services SSO users are returned. If you
--   specify <tt>SSO_GROUP</tt>, only the permissions of Amazon Web
--   Services SSO groups are returned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:workspaceId:ListPermissions'</a>,
--   <a>listPermissions_workspaceId</a> - The ID of the workspace to list
--   permissions for. This parameter is required.
newListPermissions :: Text -> ListPermissions

-- | (Optional) Limits the results to only the user that matches this ID.
listPermissions_userId :: Lens' ListPermissions (Maybe Text)

-- | The token to use when requesting the next set of results. You received
--   this token from a previous <tt>ListPermissions</tt> operation.
listPermissions_nextToken :: Lens' ListPermissions (Maybe Text)

-- | (Optional) Limits the results to only the group that matches this ID.
listPermissions_groupId :: Lens' ListPermissions (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of results to include in the response.
listPermissions_maxResults :: Lens' ListPermissions (Maybe Natural)

-- | (Optional) If you specify <tt>SSO_USER</tt>, then only the permissions
--   of Amazon Web Services SSO users are returned. If you specify
--   <tt>SSO_GROUP</tt>, only the permissions of Amazon Web Services SSO
--   groups are returned.
listPermissions_userType :: Lens' ListPermissions (Maybe UserType)

-- | The ID of the workspace to list permissions for. This parameter is
--   required.
listPermissions_workspaceId :: Lens' ListPermissions Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListPermissionsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ListPermissionsResponse
ListPermissionsResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Int -> [PermissionEntry] -> ListPermissionsResponse

-- | The token to use in a subsequent <tt>ListPermissions</tt> operation to
--   return the next set of results.
[$sel:nextToken:ListPermissionsResponse'] :: ListPermissionsResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:ListPermissionsResponse'] :: ListPermissionsResponse -> Int

-- | The permissions returned by the operation.
[$sel:permissions:ListPermissionsResponse'] :: ListPermissionsResponse -> [PermissionEntry]

-- | Create a value of <a>ListPermissionsResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListPermissions'</a>,
--   <a>listPermissionsResponse_nextToken</a> - The token to use in a
--   subsequent <tt>ListPermissions</tt> operation to return the next set
--   of results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ListPermissionsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listPermissionsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:permissions:ListPermissionsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listPermissionsResponse_permissions</a> - The permissions returned
--   by the operation.
newListPermissionsResponse :: Int -> ListPermissionsResponse

-- | The token to use in a subsequent <tt>ListPermissions</tt> operation to
--   return the next set of results.
listPermissionsResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ListPermissionsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
listPermissionsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListPermissionsResponse Int

-- | The permissions returned by the operation.
listPermissionsResponse_permissions :: Lens' ListPermissionsResponse [PermissionEntry]
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Grafana.ListPermissions.ListPermissions
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Grafana.ListPermissions.ListPermissions
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.Grafana.ListPermissions.ListPermissions
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Grafana.ListPermissions.ListPermissions
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Grafana.ListPermissions.ListPermissionsResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Grafana.ListPermissions.ListPermissionsResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.Grafana.ListPermissions.ListPermissionsResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Grafana.ListPermissions.ListPermissionsResponse
instance Amazonka.Types.AWSRequest Amazonka.Grafana.ListPermissions.ListPermissions
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Grafana.ListPermissions.ListPermissionsResponse
instance Amazonka.Pager.AWSPager Amazonka.Grafana.ListPermissions.ListPermissions
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.Grafana.ListPermissions.ListPermissions
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Grafana.ListPermissions.ListPermissions
instance Amazonka.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Amazonka.Grafana.ListPermissions.ListPermissions
instance Amazonka.Data.Path.ToPath Amazonka.Grafana.ListPermissions.ListPermissions
instance Amazonka.Data.Query.ToQuery Amazonka.Grafana.ListPermissions.ListPermissions


-- | Removes the Grafana Enterprise license from a workspace.
module Amazonka.Grafana.DisassociateLicense

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDisassociateLicense</a> smart constructor.
data DisassociateLicense
DisassociateLicense' :: LicenseType -> Text -> DisassociateLicense

-- | The type of license to remove from the workspace.
[$sel:licenseType:DisassociateLicense'] :: DisassociateLicense -> LicenseType

-- | The ID of the workspace to remove the Grafana Enterprise license from.
[$sel:workspaceId:DisassociateLicense'] :: DisassociateLicense -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DisassociateLicense</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:licenseType:DisassociateLicense'</a>,
--   <a>disassociateLicense_licenseType</a> - The type of license to remove
--   from the workspace.
--   
--   <a>$sel:workspaceId:DisassociateLicense'</a>,
--   <a>disassociateLicense_workspaceId</a> - The ID of the workspace to
--   remove the Grafana Enterprise license from.
newDisassociateLicense :: LicenseType -> Text -> DisassociateLicense

-- | The type of license to remove from the workspace.
disassociateLicense_licenseType :: Lens' DisassociateLicense LicenseType

-- | The ID of the workspace to remove the Grafana Enterprise license from.
disassociateLicense_workspaceId :: Lens' DisassociateLicense Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDisassociateLicenseResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DisassociateLicenseResponse

[$sel:httpStatus:DisassociateLicenseResponse'] :: DisassociateLicenseResponse -> Int

-- | A structure containing information about the workspace.
[$sel:workspace:DisassociateLicenseResponse'] :: DisassociateLicenseResponse -> WorkspaceDescription

--   fields omitted.
--

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   status code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:workspace:DisassociateLicenseResponse'</a>,
--   <a>disassociateLicenseResponse_workspace</a> - A structure containing
--   information about the workspace.
newDisassociateLicenseResponse :: Int -> WorkspaceDescription -> DisassociateLicenseResponse

disassociateLicenseResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DisassociateLicenseResponse Int

disassociateLicenseResponse_workspace :: Lens' DisassociateLicenseResponse WorkspaceDescription

-- | Creates a <i>workspace</i>. In a workspace, you can create Grafana
--   dashboards and visualizations to analyze your metrics, logs, and
--   traces. You don't have to build, package, or deploy any hardware to
--   run the Grafana server.
--   
--   Don't use <tt>CreateWorkspace</tt> to modify an existing workspace.
--   Instead, use <a>UpdateWorkspace</a>.
module Amazonka.Grafana.CreateWorkspace

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateWorkspace</a> smart constructor.
data CreateWorkspace
CreateWorkspace' :: Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [DataSourceType] -> Maybe [NotificationDestinationType] -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (Sensitive [Text]) -> AccountAccessType -> [AuthenticationProviderTypes] -> PermissionType -> CreateWorkspace

-- | The workspace needs an IAM role that grants permissions to the Amazon
--   Web Services resources that the workspace will view data from. If you
--   already have a role that you want to use, specify it here. If you omit
--   this field and you specify some Amazon Web Services resources in
--   <tt>workspaceDataSources</tt> or
--   <tt>workspaceNotificationDestinations</tt>, a new IAM role with the
--   necessary permissions is automatically created.
[$sel:workspaceRoleArn:CreateWorkspace'] :: CreateWorkspace -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | A unique, case-sensitive, user-provided identifier to ensure the
--   idempotency of the request.
[$sel:clientToken:CreateWorkspace'] :: CreateWorkspace -> Maybe Text

-- | Specify the Amazon Web Services data sources that you want to be
--   queried in this workspace. Specifying these data sources here enables
--   Amazon Managed Grafana to create IAM roles and permissions that allow
--   Amazon Managed Grafana to read data from these sources. You must still
--   add them as data sources in the Grafana console in the workspace.
--   
--   If you don't specify a data source here, you can still add it as a
--   data source in the workspace console later. However, you will then
--   have to manually configure permissions for it.
[$sel:workspaceDataSources:CreateWorkspace'] :: CreateWorkspace -> Maybe [DataSourceType]

-- | Specify the Amazon Web Services notification channels that you plan to
--   use in this workspace. Specifying these data sources here enables
--   Amazon Managed Grafana to create IAM roles and permissions that allow
--   Amazon Managed Grafana to use these channels.
[$sel:workspaceNotificationDestinations:CreateWorkspace'] :: CreateWorkspace -> Maybe [NotificationDestinationType]

-- | The name for the workspace. It does not have to be unique.
[$sel:workspaceName:CreateWorkspace'] :: CreateWorkspace -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | The name of an IAM role that already exists to use with Organizations
--   to access Amazon Web Services data sources and notification channels
--   in other accounts in an organization.
[$sel:organizationRoleName:CreateWorkspace'] :: CreateWorkspace -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | A description for the workspace. This is used only to help you
--   identify this workspace.
[$sel:workspaceDescription:CreateWorkspace'] :: CreateWorkspace -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | The name of the CloudFormation stack set to use to generate IAM roles
--   to be used for this workspace.
[$sel:stackSetName:CreateWorkspace'] :: CreateWorkspace -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the organizational units that this workspace is allowed to
--   use data sources from, if this workspace is in an account that is part
--   of an organization.
[$sel:workspaceOrganizationalUnits:CreateWorkspace'] :: CreateWorkspace -> Maybe (Sensitive [Text])

-- | Specifies whether the workspace can access Amazon Web Services
--   resources in this Amazon Web Services account only, or whether it can
--   also access Amazon Web Services resources in other accounts in the
--   same organization. If you specify <tt>ORGANIZATION</tt>, you must
--   specify which organizational units the workspace can access in the
--   <tt>workspaceOrganizationalUnits</tt> parameter.
[$sel:accountAccessType:CreateWorkspace'] :: CreateWorkspace -> AccountAccessType

-- | Specifies whether this workspace uses SAML 2.0, Amazon Web Services
--   Single Sign On, or both to authenticate users for using the Grafana
--   console within a workspace. For more information, see <a>User
--   authentication in Amazon Managed Grafana</a>.
[$sel:authenticationProviders:CreateWorkspace'] :: CreateWorkspace -> [AuthenticationProviderTypes]

-- | If you specify <tt>Service Managed</tt>, Amazon Managed Grafana
--   automatically creates the IAM roles and provisions the permissions
--   that the workspace needs to use Amazon Web Services data sources and
--   notification channels.
--   
--   If you specify <tt>CUSTOMER_MANAGED</tt>, you will manage those roles
--   and permissions yourself. If you are creating this workspace in a
--   member account of an organization that is not a delegated
--   administrator account, and you want the workspace to access data
--   sources in other Amazon Web Services accounts in the organization, you
--   must choose <tt>CUSTOMER_MANAGED</tt>.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Amazon Managed Grafana permissions and
--   policies for Amazon Web Services data sources and notification
--   channels</a>
[$sel:permissionType:CreateWorkspace'] :: CreateWorkspace -> PermissionType

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateWorkspace</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:workspaceRoleArn:CreateWorkspace'</a>,
--   <a>createWorkspace_workspaceRoleArn</a> - The workspace needs an IAM
--   role that grants permissions to the Amazon Web Services resources that
--   the workspace will view data from. If you already have a role that you
--   want to use, specify it here. If you omit this field and you specify
--   some Amazon Web Services resources in <tt>workspaceDataSources</tt> or
--   <tt>workspaceNotificationDestinations</tt>, a new IAM role with the
--   necessary permissions is automatically created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientToken:CreateWorkspace'</a>,
--   <a>createWorkspace_clientToken</a> - A unique, case-sensitive,
--   user-provided identifier to ensure the idempotency of the request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:workspaceDataSources:CreateWorkspace'</a>,
--   <a>createWorkspace_workspaceDataSources</a> - Specify the Amazon Web
--   Services data sources that you want to be queried in this workspace.
--   Specifying these data sources here enables Amazon Managed Grafana to
--   create IAM roles and permissions that allow Amazon Managed Grafana to
--   read data from these sources. You must still add them as data sources
--   in the Grafana console in the workspace.
--   
--   If you don't specify a data source here, you can still add it as a
--   data source in the workspace console later. However, you will then
--   have to manually configure permissions for it.
--   
--   <a>$sel:workspaceNotificationDestinations:CreateWorkspace'</a>,
--   <a>createWorkspace_workspaceNotificationDestinations</a> - Specify the
--   Amazon Web Services notification channels that you plan to use in this
--   workspace. Specifying these data sources here enables Amazon Managed
--   Grafana to create IAM roles and permissions that allow Amazon Managed
--   Grafana to use these channels.
--   
--   <a>$sel:workspaceName:CreateWorkspace'</a>,
--   <a>createWorkspace_workspaceName</a> - The name for the workspace. It
--   does not have to be unique.
--   
--   <a>$sel:organizationRoleName:CreateWorkspace'</a>,
--   <a>createWorkspace_organizationRoleName</a> - The name of an IAM role
--   that already exists to use with Organizations to access Amazon Web
--   Services data sources and notification channels in other accounts in
--   an organization.
--   
--   <a>$sel:workspaceDescription:CreateWorkspace'</a>,
--   <a>createWorkspace_workspaceDescription</a> - A description for the
--   workspace. This is used only to help you identify this workspace.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackSetName:CreateWorkspace'</a>,
--   <a>createWorkspace_stackSetName</a> - The name of the CloudFormation
--   stack set to use to generate IAM roles to be used for this workspace.
--   
--   <a>$sel:workspaceOrganizationalUnits:CreateWorkspace'</a>,
--   <a>createWorkspace_workspaceOrganizationalUnits</a> - Specifies the
--   organizational units that this workspace is allowed to use data
--   sources from, if this workspace is in an account that is part of an
--   organization.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountAccessType:CreateWorkspace'</a>,
--   <a>createWorkspace_accountAccessType</a> - Specifies whether the
--   workspace can access Amazon Web Services resources in this Amazon Web
--   Services account only, or whether it can also access Amazon Web
--   Services resources in other accounts in the same organization. If you
--   specify <tt>ORGANIZATION</tt>, you must specify which organizational
--   units the workspace can access in the
--   <tt>workspaceOrganizationalUnits</tt> parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:authenticationProviders:CreateWorkspace'</a>,
--   <a>createWorkspace_authenticationProviders</a> - Specifies whether
--   this workspace uses SAML 2.0, Amazon Web Services Single Sign On, or
--   both to authenticate users for using the Grafana console within a
--   workspace. For more information, see <a>User authentication in Amazon
--   Managed Grafana</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:permissionType:CreateWorkspace'</a>,
--   <a>createWorkspace_permissionType</a> - If you specify <tt>Service
--   Managed</tt>, Amazon Managed Grafana automatically creates the IAM
--   roles and provisions the permissions that the workspace needs to use
--   Amazon Web Services data sources and notification channels.
--   
--   If you specify <tt>CUSTOMER_MANAGED</tt>, you will manage those roles
--   and permissions yourself. If you are creating this workspace in a
--   member account of an organization that is not a delegated
--   administrator account, and you want the workspace to access data
--   sources in other Amazon Web Services accounts in the organization, you
--   must choose <tt>CUSTOMER_MANAGED</tt>.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Amazon Managed Grafana permissions and
--   policies for Amazon Web Services data sources and notification
--   channels</a>
newCreateWorkspace :: AccountAccessType -> PermissionType -> CreateWorkspace

-- | The workspace needs an IAM role that grants permissions to the Amazon
--   Web Services resources that the workspace will view data from. If you
--   already have a role that you want to use, specify it here. If you omit
--   this field and you specify some Amazon Web Services resources in
--   <tt>workspaceDataSources</tt> or
--   <tt>workspaceNotificationDestinations</tt>, a new IAM role with the
--   necessary permissions is automatically created.
createWorkspace_workspaceRoleArn :: Lens' CreateWorkspace (Maybe Text)

-- | A unique, case-sensitive, user-provided identifier to ensure the
--   idempotency of the request.
createWorkspace_clientToken :: Lens' CreateWorkspace (Maybe Text)

-- | Specify the Amazon Web Services data sources that you want to be
--   queried in this workspace. Specifying these data sources here enables
--   Amazon Managed Grafana to create IAM roles and permissions that allow
--   Amazon Managed Grafana to read data from these sources. You must still
--   add them as data sources in the Grafana console in the workspace.
--   
--   If you don't specify a data source here, you can still add it as a
--   data source in the workspace console later. However, you will then
--   have to manually configure permissions for it.
createWorkspace_workspaceDataSources :: Lens' CreateWorkspace (Maybe [DataSourceType])

-- | Specify the Amazon Web Services notification channels that you plan to
--   use in this workspace. Specifying these data sources here enables
--   Amazon Managed Grafana to create IAM roles and permissions that allow
--   Amazon Managed Grafana to use these channels.
createWorkspace_workspaceNotificationDestinations :: Lens' CreateWorkspace (Maybe [NotificationDestinationType])

-- | The name for the workspace. It does not have to be unique.
createWorkspace_workspaceName :: Lens' CreateWorkspace (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of an IAM role that already exists to use with Organizations
--   to access Amazon Web Services data sources and notification channels
--   in other accounts in an organization.
createWorkspace_organizationRoleName :: Lens' CreateWorkspace (Maybe Text)

-- | A description for the workspace. This is used only to help you
--   identify this workspace.
createWorkspace_workspaceDescription :: Lens' CreateWorkspace (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the CloudFormation stack set to use to generate IAM roles
--   to be used for this workspace.
createWorkspace_stackSetName :: Lens' CreateWorkspace (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the organizational units that this workspace is allowed to
--   use data sources from, if this workspace is in an account that is part
--   of an organization.
createWorkspace_workspaceOrganizationalUnits :: Lens' CreateWorkspace (Maybe [Text])

-- | Specifies whether the workspace can access Amazon Web Services
--   resources in this Amazon Web Services account only, or whether it can
--   also access Amazon Web Services resources in other accounts in the
--   same organization. If you specify <tt>ORGANIZATION</tt>, you must
--   specify which organizational units the workspace can access in the
--   <tt>workspaceOrganizationalUnits</tt> parameter.
createWorkspace_accountAccessType :: Lens' CreateWorkspace AccountAccessType

-- | Specifies whether this workspace uses SAML 2.0, Amazon Web Services
--   Single Sign On, or both to authenticate users for using the Grafana
--   console within a workspace. For more information, see <a>User
--   authentication in Amazon Managed Grafana</a>.
createWorkspace_authenticationProviders :: Lens' CreateWorkspace [AuthenticationProviderTypes]

-- | If you specify <tt>Service Managed</tt>, Amazon Managed Grafana
--   automatically creates the IAM roles and provisions the permissions
--   that the workspace needs to use Amazon Web Services data sources and
--   notification channels.
--   
--   If you specify <tt>CUSTOMER_MANAGED</tt>, you will manage those roles
--   and permissions yourself. If you are creating this workspace in a
--   member account of an organization that is not a delegated
--   administrator account, and you want the workspace to access data
--   sources in other Amazon Web Services accounts in the organization, you
--   must choose <tt>CUSTOMER_MANAGED</tt>.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Amazon Managed Grafana permissions and
--   policies for Amazon Web Services data sources and notification
--   channels</a>
createWorkspace_permissionType :: Lens' CreateWorkspace PermissionType

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateWorkspaceResponse</a> smart constructor.
data CreateWorkspaceResponse
CreateWorkspaceResponse' :: Int -> WorkspaceDescription -> CreateWorkspaceResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:CreateWorkspaceResponse'] :: CreateWorkspaceResponse -> Int

-- | A structure containing data about the workspace that was created.
[$sel:workspace:CreateWorkspaceResponse'] :: CreateWorkspaceResponse -> WorkspaceDescription

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateWorkspaceResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:CreateWorkspaceResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createWorkspaceResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:workspace:CreateWorkspaceResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createWorkspaceResponse_workspace</a> - A structure containing data
--   about the workspace that was created.
newCreateWorkspaceResponse :: Int -> WorkspaceDescription -> CreateWorkspaceResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
createWorkspaceResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' CreateWorkspaceResponse Int

-- | A structure containing data about the workspace that was created.
createWorkspaceResponse_workspace :: Lens' CreateWorkspaceResponse WorkspaceDescription
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Grafana.CreateWorkspace.CreateWorkspace
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Grafana.CreateWorkspace.CreateWorkspace
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Grafana.CreateWorkspace.CreateWorkspace
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Grafana.CreateWorkspace.CreateWorkspaceResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Grafana.CreateWorkspace.CreateWorkspaceResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Grafana.CreateWorkspace.CreateWorkspaceResponse
instance Amazonka.Types.AWSRequest Amazonka.Grafana.CreateWorkspace.CreateWorkspace
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Grafana.CreateWorkspace.CreateWorkspaceResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.Grafana.CreateWorkspace.CreateWorkspace
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Grafana.CreateWorkspace.CreateWorkspace
instance Amazonka.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Amazonka.Grafana.CreateWorkspace.CreateWorkspace
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.Grafana.CreateWorkspace.CreateWorkspace
instance Amazonka.Data.Path.ToPath Amazonka.Grafana.CreateWorkspace.CreateWorkspace
instance Amazonka.Data.Query.ToQuery Amazonka.Grafana.CreateWorkspace.CreateWorkspace


-- | Assigns a Grafana Enterprise license to a workspace. Upgrading to
--   Grafana Enterprise incurs additional fees. For more information, see
--   <a>Upgrade a workspace to Grafana Enterprise</a>.
module Amazonka.Grafana.AssociateLicense

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newAssociateLicense</a> smart constructor.
data AssociateLicense
AssociateLicense' :: LicenseType -> Text -> AssociateLicense

-- | The type of license to associate with the workspace.
[$sel:licenseType:AssociateLicense'] :: AssociateLicense -> LicenseType

-- | The ID of the workspace to associate the license with.
[$sel:workspaceId:AssociateLicense'] :: AssociateLicense -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AssociateLicense</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:licenseType:AssociateLicense'</a>,
--   <a>associateLicense_licenseType</a> - The type of license to associate
--   with the workspace.
--   
--   <a>$sel:workspaceId:AssociateLicense'</a>,
--   <a>associateLicense_workspaceId</a> - The ID of the workspace to
--   associate the license with.
newAssociateLicense :: LicenseType -> Text -> AssociateLicense

-- | The type of license to associate with the workspace.
associateLicense_licenseType :: Lens' AssociateLicense LicenseType

-- | The ID of the workspace to associate the license with.
associateLicense_workspaceId :: Lens' AssociateLicense Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newAssociateLicenseResponse</a> smart constructor.
data AssociateLicenseResponse

[$sel:httpStatus:AssociateLicenseResponse'] :: AssociateLicenseResponse -> Int

--   fields omitted.

--   fields.

-- | Updates which users in a workspace have the Grafana <tt>Admin</tt> or
--   <tt>Editor</tt> roles.
module Amazonka.Grafana.UpdatePermissions

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdatePermissions</a> smart constructor.
data UpdatePermissions
UpdatePermissions' :: [UpdateInstruction] -> Text -> UpdatePermissions

-- | An array of structures that contain the permission updates to make.
[$sel:updateInstructionBatch:UpdatePermissions'] :: UpdatePermissions -> [UpdateInstruction]

-- | The ID of the workspace to update.
[$sel:workspaceId:UpdatePermissions'] :: UpdatePermissions -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdatePermissions</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   structures that contain the permission updates to make.
--   
--   <a>$sel:workspaceId:UpdatePermissions'</a>,
--   <a>updatePermissions_workspaceId</a> - The ID of the workspace to
--   update.
newUpdatePermissions :: Text -> UpdatePermissions

-- | An array of structures that contain the permission updates to make.
updatePermissions_updateInstructionBatch :: Lens' UpdatePermissions [UpdateInstruction]

-- | The ID of the workspace to update.
updatePermissions_workspaceId :: Lens' UpdatePermissions Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdatePermissionsResponse</a> smart constructor.

--   any.

updatePermissionsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' UpdatePermissionsResponse Int

--   any.
updatePermissionsResponse_errors :: Lens' UpdatePermissionsResponse [UpdateError]
