-- | Modifies an existing Amazon Managed Grafana workspace. If you use this
--   operation and omit any optional parameters, the existing values of
--   those parameters are not changed.
--   
--   To modify the user authentication methods that the workspace uses,
--   such as SAML or Amazon Web Services SSO, use
--   <a>UpdateWorkspaceAuthentication</a>.
--   
--   To modify which users in the workspace have the <tt>Admin</tt> and
--   <tt>Editor</tt> Grafana roles, use <a>UpdatePermissions</a>.
module Amazonka.Grafana.UpdateWorkspace

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateWorkspace</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateWorkspace
UpdateWorkspace' :: Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe [DataSourceType] -> Maybe PermissionType -> Maybe [NotificationDestinationType] -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe AccountAccessType -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (Sensitive [Text]) -> Text -> UpdateWorkspace

-- | The workspace needs an IAM role that grants permissions to the Amazon
--   Web Services resources that the workspace will view data from. If you
--   already have a role that you want to use, specify it here. If you omit
--   this field and you specify some Amazon Web Services resources in
--   <tt>workspaceDataSources</tt> or
--   <tt>workspaceNotificationDestinations</tt>, a new IAM role with the
--   necessary permissions is automatically created.
[$sel:workspaceRoleArn:UpdateWorkspace'] :: UpdateWorkspace -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | Specify the Amazon Web Services data sources that you want to be
--   queried in this workspace. Specifying these data sources here enables
--   Amazon Managed Grafana to create IAM roles and permissions that allow
--   Amazon Managed Grafana to read data from these sources. You must still
--   add them as data sources in the Grafana console in the workspace.
--   
--   If you don't specify a data source here, you can still add it as a
--   data source later in the workspace console. However, you will then
--   have to manually configure permissions for it.
[$sel:workspaceDataSources:UpdateWorkspace'] :: UpdateWorkspace -> Maybe [DataSourceType]

-- | If you specify <tt>Service Managed</tt>, Amazon Managed Grafana
--   automatically creates the IAM roles and provisions the permissions
--   that the workspace needs to use Amazon Web Services data sources and
--   notification channels.
--   
--   If you specify <tt>CUSTOMER_MANAGED</tt>, you will manage those roles
--   and permissions yourself. If you are creating this workspace in a
--   member account of an organization and that account is not a delegated
--   administrator account, and you want the workspace to access data
--   sources in other Amazon Web Services accounts in the organization, you
--   must choose <tt>CUSTOMER_MANAGED</tt>.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Amazon Managed Grafana permissions and
--   policies for Amazon Web Services data sources and notification
--   channels</a>
[$sel:permissionType:UpdateWorkspace'] :: UpdateWorkspace -> Maybe PermissionType

-- | Specify the Amazon Web Services notification channels that you plan to
--   use in this workspace. Specifying these data sources here enables
--   Amazon Managed Grafana to create IAM roles and permissions that allow
--   Amazon Managed Grafana to use these channels.
[$sel:workspaceNotificationDestinations:UpdateWorkspace'] :: UpdateWorkspace -> Maybe [NotificationDestinationType]

-- | A new name for the workspace to update.
[$sel:workspaceName:UpdateWorkspace'] :: UpdateWorkspace -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | Specifies whether the workspace can access Amazon Web Services
--   resources in this Amazon Web Services account only, or whether it can
--   also access Amazon Web Services resources in other accounts in the
--   same organization. If you specify <tt>ORGANIZATION</tt>, you must
--   specify which organizational units the workspace can access in the
--   <tt>workspaceOrganizationalUnits</tt> parameter.
[$sel:accountAccessType:UpdateWorkspace'] :: UpdateWorkspace -> Maybe AccountAccessType

-- | The name of an IAM role that already exists to use to access resources
--   through Organizations.
[$sel:organizationRoleName:UpdateWorkspace'] :: UpdateWorkspace -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | A description for the workspace. This is used only to help you
--   identify this workspace.
[$sel:workspaceDescription:UpdateWorkspace'] :: UpdateWorkspace -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | The name of the CloudFormation stack set to use to generate IAM roles
--   to be used for this workspace.
[$sel:stackSetName:UpdateWorkspace'] :: UpdateWorkspace -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the organizational units that this workspace is allowed to
--   use data sources from, if this workspace is in an account that is part
--   of an organization.
[$sel:workspaceOrganizationalUnits:UpdateWorkspace'] :: UpdateWorkspace -> Maybe (Sensitive [Text])

-- | The ID of the workspace to update.
[$sel:workspaceId:UpdateWorkspace'] :: UpdateWorkspace -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateWorkspace</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:workspaceRoleArn:UpdateWorkspace'</a>,
--   <a>updateWorkspace_workspaceRoleArn</a> - The workspace needs an IAM
--   role that grants permissions to the Amazon Web Services resources that
--   the workspace will view data from. If you already have a role that you
--   want to use, specify it here. If you omit this field and you specify
--   some Amazon Web Services resources in <tt>workspaceDataSources</tt> or
--   <tt>workspaceNotificationDestinations</tt>, a new IAM role with the
--   necessary permissions is automatically created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:workspaceDataSources:UpdateWorkspace'</a>,
--   <a>updateWorkspace_workspaceDataSources</a> - Specify the Amazon Web
--   Services data sources that you want to be queried in this workspace.
--   Specifying these data sources here enables Amazon Managed Grafana to
--   create IAM roles and permissions that allow Amazon Managed Grafana to
--   read data from these sources. You must still add them as data sources
--   in the Grafana console in the workspace.
--   
--   If you don't specify a data source here, you can still add it as a
--   data source later in the workspace console. However, you will then
--   have to manually configure permissions for it.
--   
--   <a>$sel:permissionType:UpdateWorkspace'</a>,
--   <a>updateWorkspace_permissionType</a> - If you specify <tt>Service
--   Managed</tt>, Amazon Managed Grafana automatically creates the IAM
--   roles and provisions the permissions that the workspace needs to use
--   Amazon Web Services data sources and notification channels.
--   
--   If you specify <tt>CUSTOMER_MANAGED</tt>, you will manage those roles
--   and permissions yourself. If you are creating this workspace in a
--   member account of an organization and that account is not a delegated
--   administrator account, and you want the workspace to access data
--   sources in other Amazon Web Services accounts in the organization, you
--   must choose <tt>CUSTOMER_MANAGED</tt>.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Amazon Managed Grafana permissions and
--   policies for Amazon Web Services data sources and notification
--   channels</a>
--   
--   <a>$sel:workspaceNotificationDestinations:UpdateWorkspace'</a>,
--   <a>updateWorkspace_workspaceNotificationDestinations</a> - Specify the
--   Amazon Web Services notification channels that you plan to use in this
--   workspace. Specifying these data sources here enables Amazon Managed
--   Grafana to create IAM roles and permissions that allow Amazon Managed
--   Grafana to use these channels.
--   
--   <a>$sel:workspaceName:UpdateWorkspace'</a>,
--   <a>updateWorkspace_workspaceName</a> - A new name for the workspace to
--   update.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountAccessType:UpdateWorkspace'</a>,
--   <a>updateWorkspace_accountAccessType</a> - Specifies whether the
--   workspace can access Amazon Web Services resources in this Amazon Web
--   Services account only, or whether it can also access Amazon Web
--   Services resources in other accounts in the same organization. If you
--   specify <tt>ORGANIZATION</tt>, you must specify which organizational
--   units the workspace can access in the
--   <tt>workspaceOrganizationalUnits</tt> parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:organizationRoleName:UpdateWorkspace'</a>,
--   <a>updateWorkspace_organizationRoleName</a> - The name of an IAM role
--   that already exists to use to access resources through Organizations.
--   
--   <a>$sel:workspaceDescription:UpdateWorkspace'</a>,
--   <a>updateWorkspace_workspaceDescription</a> - A description for the
--   workspace. This is used only to help you identify this workspace.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackSetName:UpdateWorkspace'</a>,
--   <a>updateWorkspace_stackSetName</a> - The name of the CloudFormation
--   stack set to use to generate IAM roles to be used for this workspace.
--   
--   <a>$sel:workspaceOrganizationalUnits:UpdateWorkspace'</a>,
--   <a>updateWorkspace_workspaceOrganizationalUnits</a> - Specifies the
--   organizational units that this workspace is allowed to use data
--   sources from, if this workspace is in an account that is part of an
--   organization.
--   
--   <a>$sel:workspaceId:UpdateWorkspace'</a>,
--   <a>updateWorkspace_workspaceId</a> - The ID of the workspace to
--   update.
newUpdateWorkspace :: Text -> UpdateWorkspace

-- | The workspace needs an IAM role that grants permissions to the Amazon
--   Web Services resources that the workspace will view data from. If you
--   already have a role that you want to use, specify it here. If you omit
--   this field and you specify some Amazon Web Services resources in
--   <tt>workspaceDataSources</tt> or
--   <tt>workspaceNotificationDestinations</tt>, a new IAM role with the
--   necessary permissions is automatically created.
updateWorkspace_workspaceRoleArn :: Lens' UpdateWorkspace (Maybe Text)

-- | Specify the Amazon Web Services data sources that you want to be
--   queried in this workspace. Specifying these data sources here enables
--   Amazon Managed Grafana to create IAM roles and permissions that allow
--   Amazon Managed Grafana to read data from these sources. You must still
--   add them as data sources in the Grafana console in the workspace.
--   
--   If you don't specify a data source here, you can still add it as a
--   data source later in the workspace console. However, you will then
--   have to manually configure permissions for it.
updateWorkspace_workspaceDataSources :: Lens' UpdateWorkspace (Maybe [DataSourceType])

-- | If you specify <tt>Service Managed</tt>, Amazon Managed Grafana
--   automatically creates the IAM roles and provisions the permissions
--   that the workspace needs to use Amazon Web Services data sources and
--   notification channels.
--   
--   If you specify <tt>CUSTOMER_MANAGED</tt>, you will manage those roles
--   and permissions yourself. If you are creating this workspace in a
--   member account of an organization and that account is not a delegated
--   administrator account, and you want the workspace to access data
--   sources in other Amazon Web Services accounts in the organization, you
--   must choose <tt>CUSTOMER_MANAGED</tt>.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Amazon Managed Grafana permissions and
--   policies for Amazon Web Services data sources and notification
--   channels</a>
updateWorkspace_permissionType :: Lens' UpdateWorkspace (Maybe PermissionType)

-- | Specify the Amazon Web Services notification channels that you plan to
--   use in this workspace. Specifying these data sources here enables
--   Amazon Managed Grafana to create IAM roles and permissions that allow
--   Amazon Managed Grafana to use these channels.
updateWorkspace_workspaceNotificationDestinations :: Lens' UpdateWorkspace (Maybe [NotificationDestinationType])

-- | A new name for the workspace to update.
updateWorkspace_workspaceName :: Lens' UpdateWorkspace (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether the workspace can access Amazon Web Services
--   resources in this Amazon Web Services account only, or whether it can
--   also access Amazon Web Services resources in other accounts in the
--   same organization. If you specify <tt>ORGANIZATION</tt>, you must
--   specify which organizational units the workspace can access in the
--   <tt>workspaceOrganizationalUnits</tt> parameter.
updateWorkspace_accountAccessType :: Lens' UpdateWorkspace (Maybe AccountAccessType)

-- | The name of an IAM role that already exists to use to access resources
--   through Organizations.
updateWorkspace_organizationRoleName :: Lens' UpdateWorkspace (Maybe Text)

-- | A description for the workspace. This is used only to help you
--   identify this workspace.
updateWorkspace_workspaceDescription :: Lens' UpdateWorkspace (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the CloudFormation stack set to use to generate IAM roles
--   to be used for this workspace.
updateWorkspace_stackSetName :: Lens' UpdateWorkspace (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the organizational units that this workspace is allowed to
--   use data sources from, if this workspace is in an account that is part
--   of an organization.
updateWorkspace_workspaceOrganizationalUnits :: Lens' UpdateWorkspace (Maybe [Text])

-- | The ID of the workspace to update.
updateWorkspace_workspaceId :: Lens' UpdateWorkspace Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateWorkspaceResponse</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateWorkspaceResponse
UpdateWorkspaceResponse' :: Int -> WorkspaceDescription -> UpdateWorkspaceResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:UpdateWorkspaceResponse'] :: UpdateWorkspaceResponse -> Int

-- | A structure containing data about the workspace that was created.
[$sel:workspace:UpdateWorkspaceResponse'] :: UpdateWorkspaceResponse -> WorkspaceDescription

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateWorkspaceResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:UpdateWorkspaceResponse'</a>,
--   <a>updateWorkspaceResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:workspace:UpdateWorkspaceResponse'</a>,
--   <a>updateWorkspaceResponse_workspace</a> - A structure containing data
--   about the workspace that was created.
newUpdateWorkspaceResponse :: Int -> WorkspaceDescription -> UpdateWorkspaceResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
updateWorkspaceResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' UpdateWorkspaceResponse Int

-- | A structure containing data about the workspace that was created.
updateWorkspaceResponse_workspace :: Lens' UpdateWorkspaceResponse WorkspaceDescription
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Grafana.UpdateWorkspace.UpdateWorkspace
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Grafana.UpdateWorkspace.UpdateWorkspace
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Grafana.UpdateWorkspace.UpdateWorkspace
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Grafana.UpdateWorkspace.UpdateWorkspaceResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Grafana.UpdateWorkspace.UpdateWorkspaceResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Grafana.UpdateWorkspace.UpdateWorkspaceResponse
instance Amazonka.Types.AWSRequest Amazonka.Grafana.UpdateWorkspace.UpdateWorkspace
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Grafana.UpdateWorkspace.UpdateWorkspaceResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.Grafana.UpdateWorkspace.UpdateWorkspace
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Grafana.UpdateWorkspace.UpdateWorkspace
instance Amazonka.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Amazonka.Grafana.UpdateWorkspace.UpdateWorkspace
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.Grafana.UpdateWorkspace.UpdateWorkspace
instance Amazonka.Data.Path.ToPath Amazonka.Grafana.UpdateWorkspace.UpdateWorkspace
instance Amazonka.Data.Query.ToQuery Amazonka.Grafana.UpdateWorkspace.UpdateWorkspace


-- | Use this operation to define the identity provider (IdP) that this
--   workspace authenticates users from, using SAML. You can also map SAML
--   assertion attributes to workspace user information and define which
--   groups in the assertion attribute are to have the <tt>Admin</tt> and
--   <tt>Editor</tt> roles in the workspace.
module Amazonka.Grafana.UpdateWorkspaceAuthentication

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateWorkspaceAuthentication</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateWorkspaceAuthentication
UpdateWorkspaceAuthentication' :: Maybe SamlConfiguration -> [AuthenticationProviderTypes] -> Text -> UpdateWorkspaceAuthentication

-- | If the workspace uses SAML, use this structure to map SAML assertion
--   attributes to workspace user information and define which groups in
--   the assertion attribute are to have the <tt>Admin</tt> and
--   <tt>Editor</tt> roles in the workspace.
[$sel:samlConfiguration:UpdateWorkspaceAuthentication'] :: UpdateWorkspaceAuthentication -> Maybe SamlConfiguration

-- | Specifies whether this workspace uses SAML 2.0, Amazon Web Services
--   Single Sign On, or both to authenticate users for using the Grafana
--   console within a workspace. For more information, see <a>User
--   authentication in Amazon Managed Grafana</a>.
[$sel:authenticationProviders:UpdateWorkspaceAuthentication'] :: UpdateWorkspaceAuthentication -> [AuthenticationProviderTypes]

-- | The ID of the workspace to update the authentication for.
[$sel:workspaceId:UpdateWorkspaceAuthentication'] :: UpdateWorkspaceAuthentication -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateWorkspaceAuthentication</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:samlConfiguration:UpdateWorkspaceAuthentication'</a>,
--   <a>updateWorkspaceAuthentication_samlConfiguration</a> - If the
--   workspace uses SAML, use this structure to map SAML assertion
--   attributes to workspace user information and define which groups in
--   the assertion attribute are to have the <tt>Admin</tt> and
--   <tt>Editor</tt> roles in the workspace.
--   
--   <a>$sel:authenticationProviders:UpdateWorkspaceAuthentication'</a>,
--   <a>updateWorkspaceAuthentication_authenticationProviders</a> -
--   Specifies whether this workspace uses SAML 2.0, Amazon Web Services
--   Single Sign On, or both to authenticate users for using the Grafana
--   console within a workspace. For more information, see <a>User
--   authentication in Amazon Managed Grafana</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:workspaceId:UpdateWorkspaceAuthentication'</a>,
--   <a>updateWorkspaceAuthentication_workspaceId</a> - The ID of the
--   workspace to update the authentication for.
newUpdateWorkspaceAuthentication :: Text -> UpdateWorkspaceAuthentication

-- | If the workspace uses SAML, use this structure to map SAML assertion
--   attributes to workspace user information and define which groups in
--   the assertion attribute are to have the <tt>Admin</tt> and
--   <tt>Editor</tt> roles in the workspace.
updateWorkspaceAuthentication_samlConfiguration :: Lens' UpdateWorkspaceAuthentication (Maybe SamlConfiguration)

-- | Specifies whether this workspace uses SAML 2.0, Amazon Web Services
--   Single Sign On, or both to authenticate users for using the Grafana
--   console within a workspace. For more information, see <a>User
--   authentication in Amazon Managed Grafana</a>.
updateWorkspaceAuthentication_authenticationProviders :: Lens' UpdateWorkspaceAuthentication [AuthenticationProviderTypes]

-- | The ID of the workspace to update the authentication for.
updateWorkspaceAuthentication_workspaceId :: Lens' UpdateWorkspaceAuthentication Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateWorkspaceAuthenticationResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data UpdateWorkspaceAuthenticationResponse
UpdateWorkspaceAuthenticationResponse' :: Int -> AuthenticationDescription -> UpdateWorkspaceAuthenticationResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:UpdateWorkspaceAuthenticationResponse'] :: UpdateWorkspaceAuthenticationResponse -> Int

-- | A structure that describes the user authentication for this workspace
--   after the update is made.
[$sel:authentication:UpdateWorkspaceAuthenticationResponse'] :: UpdateWorkspaceAuthenticationResponse -> AuthenticationDescription

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateWorkspaceAuthenticationResponse</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:UpdateWorkspaceAuthenticationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>updateWorkspaceAuthenticationResponse_httpStatus</a> - The
--   response's http status code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:authentication:UpdateWorkspaceAuthenticationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>updateWorkspaceAuthenticationResponse_authentication</a> - A
--   structure that describes the user authentication for this workspace
--   after the update is made.
newUpdateWorkspaceAuthenticationResponse :: Int -> AuthenticationDescription -> UpdateWorkspaceAuthenticationResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
updateWorkspaceAuthenticationResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' UpdateWorkspaceAuthenticationResponse Int

-- | A structure that describes the user authentication for this workspace
--   after the update is made.
updateWorkspaceAuthenticationResponse_authentication :: Lens' UpdateWorkspaceAuthenticationResponse AuthenticationDescription
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Grafana.UpdateWorkspaceAuthentication.UpdateWorkspaceAuthentication
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Grafana.UpdateWorkspaceAuthentication.UpdateWorkspaceAuthentication
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.Grafana.UpdateWorkspaceAuthentication.UpdateWorkspaceAuthentication
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Grafana.UpdateWorkspaceAuthentication.UpdateWorkspaceAuthentication

module Amazonka.Grafana.Lens

-- | The token for the next set of workspaces to return. (You receive this
--   token from a previous <tt>ListWorkspaces</tt> operation.)
listWorkspaces_nextToken :: Lens' ListWorkspaces (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of workspaces to include in the results.
listWorkspaces_maxResults :: Lens' ListWorkspaces (Maybe Natural)

-- | The token to use when requesting the next set of workspaces.
listWorkspacesResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ListWorkspacesResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
listWorkspacesResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListWorkspacesResponse Int

-- | An array of structures that contain some information about the
--   workspaces in the account.
listWorkspacesResponse_workspaces :: Lens' ListWorkspacesResponse [WorkspaceSummary]

-- | The ID of the workspace to delete.
deleteWorkspace_workspaceId :: Lens' DeleteWorkspace Text

-- | The response's http status code.
deleteWorkspaceResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DeleteWorkspaceResponse Int

-- | A structure containing information about the workspace that was
--   deleted.
deleteWorkspaceResponse_workspace :: Lens' DeleteWorkspaceResponse WorkspaceDescription

-- | The workspace needs an IAM role that grants permissions to the Amazon
--   Web Services resources that the workspace will view data from. If you
--   already have a role that you want to use, specify it here. If you omit
--   this field and you specify some Amazon Web Services resources in
--   <tt>workspaceDataSources</tt> or
--   <tt>workspaceNotificationDestinations</tt>, a new IAM role with the
--   necessary permissions is automatically created.
updateWorkspace_workspaceRoleArn :: Lens' UpdateWorkspace (Maybe Text)

-- | Specify the Amazon Web Services data sources that you want to be
--   queried in this workspace. Specifying these data sources here enables
--   Amazon Managed Grafana to create IAM roles and permissions that allow
--   Amazon Managed Grafana to read data from these sources. You must still
--   add them as data sources in the Grafana console in the workspace.
--   
--   If you don't specify a data source here, you can still add it as a
--   data source later in the workspace console. However, you will then
--   have to manually configure permissions for it.
updateWorkspace_workspaceDataSources :: Lens' UpdateWorkspace (Maybe [DataSourceType])

-- | If you specify <tt>Service Managed</tt>, Amazon Managed Grafana
--   automatically creates the IAM roles and provisions the permissions
--   that the workspace needs to use Amazon Web Services data sources and
--   notification channels.
--   
--   If you specify <tt>CUSTOMER_MANAGED</tt>, you will manage those roles
--   and permissions yourself. If you are creating this workspace in a
--   member account of an organization and that account is not a delegated
--   administrator account, and you want the workspace to access data
--   sources in other Amazon Web Services accounts in the organization, you
--   must choose <tt>CUSTOMER_MANAGED</tt>.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Amazon Managed Grafana permissions and
--   policies for Amazon Web Services data sources and notification
--   channels</a>
updateWorkspace_permissionType :: Lens' UpdateWorkspace (Maybe PermissionType)

-- | Specify the Amazon Web Services notification channels that you plan to
--   use in this workspace. Specifying these data sources here enables
--   Amazon Managed Grafana to create IAM roles and permissions that allow
--   Amazon Managed Grafana to use these channels.
updateWorkspace_workspaceNotificationDestinations :: Lens' UpdateWorkspace (Maybe [NotificationDestinationType])

-- | A new name for the workspace to update.
updateWorkspace_workspaceName :: Lens' UpdateWorkspace (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether the workspace can access Amazon Web Services
--   resources in this Amazon Web Services account only, or whether it can
--   also access Amazon Web Services resources in other accounts in the
--   same organization. If you specify <tt>ORGANIZATION</tt>, you must
--   specify which organizational units the workspace can access in the
--   <tt>workspaceOrganizationalUnits</tt> parameter.
updateWorkspace_accountAccessType :: Lens' UpdateWorkspace (Maybe AccountAccessType)

-- | The name of an IAM role that already exists to use to access resources
--   through Organizations.
updateWorkspace_organizationRoleName :: Lens' UpdateWorkspace (Maybe Text)

-- | A description for the workspace. This is used only to help you
--   identify this workspace.
updateWorkspace_workspaceDescription :: Lens' UpdateWorkspace (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the CloudFormation stack set to use to generate IAM roles
--   to be used for this workspace.
updateWorkspace_stackSetName :: Lens' UpdateWorkspace (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the organizational units that this workspace is allowed to
--   use data sources from, if this workspace is in an account that is part
--   of an organization.
updateWorkspace_workspaceOrganizationalUnits :: Lens' UpdateWorkspace (Maybe [Text])

-- | The ID of the workspace to update.
updateWorkspace_workspaceId :: Lens' UpdateWorkspace Text

-- | The response's http status code.
updateWorkspaceResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' UpdateWorkspaceResponse Int

-- | A structure containing data about the workspace that was created.
updateWorkspaceResponse_workspace :: Lens' UpdateWorkspaceResponse WorkspaceDescription

-- | If the workspace uses SAML, use this structure to map SAML assertion
--   attributes to workspace user information and define which groups in
--   the assertion attribute are to have the <tt>Admin</tt> and
--   <tt>Editor</tt> roles in the workspace.
updateWorkspaceAuthentication_samlConfiguration :: Lens' UpdateWorkspaceAuthentication (Maybe SamlConfiguration)

-- | Specifies whether this workspace uses SAML 2.0, Amazon Web Services
--   Single Sign On, or both to authenticate users for using the Grafana
--   console within a workspace. For more information, see <a>User
--   authentication in Amazon Managed Grafana</a>.
updateWorkspaceAuthentication_authenticationProviders :: Lens' UpdateWorkspaceAuthentication [AuthenticationProviderTypes]

-- | The ID of the workspace to update the authentication for.
updateWorkspaceAuthentication_workspaceId :: Lens' UpdateWorkspaceAuthentication Text

-- | The response's http status code.
updateWorkspaceAuthenticationResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' UpdateWorkspaceAuthenticationResponse Int

-- | A structure that describes the user authentication for this workspace
--   after the update is made.
updateWorkspaceAuthenticationResponse_authentication :: Lens' UpdateWorkspaceAuthenticationResponse AuthenticationDescription

-- | The ID of the workspace to return authentication information about.
describeWorkspaceAuthentication_workspaceId :: Lens' DescribeWorkspaceAuthentication Text

-- | The response's http status code.
describeWorkspaceAuthenticationResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribeWorkspaceAuthenticationResponse Int

-- | A structure containing information about the authentication methods
--   used in the workspace.
describeWorkspaceAuthenticationResponse_authentication :: Lens' DescribeWorkspaceAuthenticationResponse AuthenticationDescription

-- | The ID of the workspace to display information about.
describeWorkspace_workspaceId :: Lens' DescribeWorkspace Text

-- | The response's http status code.
describeWorkspaceResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribeWorkspaceResponse Int

-- | A structure containing information about the workspace.
describeWorkspaceResponse_workspace :: Lens' DescribeWorkspaceResponse WorkspaceDescription

-- | The type of license to associate with the workspace.
associateLicense_licenseType :: Lens' AssociateLicense LicenseType

-- | The ID of the workspace to associate the license with.
associateLicense_workspaceId :: Lens' AssociateLicense Text

-- | The response's http status code.
associateLicenseResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' AssociateLicenseResponse Int

-- | A structure containing data about the workspace.
associateLicenseResponse_workspace :: Lens' AssociateLicenseResponse WorkspaceDescription

-- | (Optional) Limits the results to only the user that matches this ID.
listPermissions_userId :: Lens' ListPermissions (Maybe Text)

-- | The token to use when requesting the next set of results. You received
--   this token from a previous <tt>ListPermissions</tt> operation.
listPermissions_nextToken :: Lens' ListPermissions (Maybe Text)

-- | (Optional) Limits the results to only the group that matches this ID.
listPermissions_groupId :: Lens' ListPermissions (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of results to include in the response.
listPermissions_maxResults :: Lens' ListPermissions (Maybe Natural)

-- | (Optional) If you specify <tt>SSO_USER</tt>, then only the permissions
--   of Amazon Web Services SSO users are returned. If you specify
--   <tt>SSO_GROUP</tt>, only the permissions of Amazon Web Services SSO
--   groups are returned.
listPermissions_userType :: Lens' ListPermissions (Maybe UserType)

-- | The ID of the workspace to list permissions for. This parameter is
--   required.
listPermissions_workspaceId :: Lens' ListPermissions Text

-- | The token to use in a subsequent <tt>ListPermissions</tt> operation to
--   return the next set of results.
listPermissionsResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ListPermissionsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
listPermissionsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListPermissionsResponse Int

-- | The permissions returned by the operation.
listPermissionsResponse_permissions :: Lens' ListPermissionsResponse [PermissionEntry]

-- | An array of structures that contain the permission updates to make.
updatePermissions_updateInstructionBatch :: Lens' UpdatePermissions [UpdateInstruction]

-- | The ID of the workspace to update.
updatePermissions_workspaceId :: Lens' UpdatePermissions Text

-- | The response's http status code.
updatePermissionsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' UpdatePermissionsResponse Int

-- | An array of structures that contain the errors from the operation, if
--   any.
updatePermissionsResponse_errors :: Lens' UpdatePermissionsResponse [UpdateError]

-- | The type of license to remove from the workspace.
disassociateLicense_licenseType :: Lens' DisassociateLicense LicenseType

-- | The ID of the workspace to remove the Grafana Enterprise license from.
disassociateLicense_workspaceId :: Lens' DisassociateLicense Text

-- | The response's http status code.
disassociateLicenseResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DisassociateLicenseResponse Int

-- | A structure containing information about the workspace.
disassociateLicenseResponse_workspace :: Lens' DisassociateLicenseResponse WorkspaceDescription

-- | The workspace needs an IAM role that grants permissions to the Amazon
--   Web Services resources that the workspace will view data from. If you
--   already have a role that you want to use, specify it here. If you omit
--   this field and you specify some Amazon Web Services resources in
--   <tt>workspaceDataSources</tt> or
--   <tt>workspaceNotificationDestinations</tt>, a new IAM role with the
--   necessary permissions is automatically created.
createWorkspace_workspaceRoleArn :: Lens' CreateWorkspace (Maybe Text)

-- | A unique, case-sensitive, user-provided identifier to ensure the
--   idempotency of the request.
createWorkspace_clientToken :: Lens' CreateWorkspace (Maybe Text)

-- | Specify the Amazon Web Services data sources that you want to be
--   queried in this workspace. Specifying these data sources here enables
--   Amazon Managed Grafana to create IAM roles and permissions that allow
--   Amazon Managed Grafana to read data from these sources. You must still
--   add them as data sources in the Grafana console in the workspace.
--   
--   If you don't specify a data source here, you can still add it as a
--   data source in the workspace console later. However, you will then
--   have to manually configure permissions for it.
createWorkspace_workspaceDataSources :: Lens' CreateWorkspace (Maybe [DataSourceType])

-- | Specify the Amazon Web Services notification channels that you plan to
--   use in this workspace. Specifying these data sources here enables
--   Amazon Managed Grafana to create IAM roles and permissions that allow
--   Amazon Managed Grafana to use these channels.
createWorkspace_workspaceNotificationDestinations :: Lens' CreateWorkspace (Maybe [NotificationDestinationType])

-- | The name for the workspace. It does not have to be unique.
createWorkspace_workspaceName :: Lens' CreateWorkspace (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of an IAM role that already exists to use with Organizations
--   to access Amazon Web Services data sources and notification channels
--   in other accounts in an organization.
createWorkspace_organizationRoleName :: Lens' CreateWorkspace (Maybe Text)

-- | A description for the workspace. This is used only to help you
--   identify this workspace.
createWorkspace_workspaceDescription :: Lens' CreateWorkspace (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the CloudFormation stack set to use to generate IAM roles
--   to be used for this workspace.
createWorkspace_stackSetName :: Lens' CreateWorkspace (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the organizational units that this workspace is allowed to
--   use data sources from, if this workspace is in an account that is part
--   of an organization.
createWorkspace_workspaceOrganizationalUnits :: Lens' CreateWorkspace (Maybe [Text])

-- | Specifies whether the workspace can access Amazon Web Services
--   resources in this Amazon Web Services account only, or whether it can
--   also access Amazon Web Services resources in other accounts in the
--   same organization. If you specify <tt>ORGANIZATION</tt>, you must
--   specify which organizational units the workspace can access in the
--   <tt>workspaceOrganizationalUnits</tt> parameter.
createWorkspace_accountAccessType :: Lens' CreateWorkspace AccountAccessType

-- | Specifies whether this workspace uses SAML 2.0, Amazon Web Services
--   Single Sign On, or both to authenticate users for using the Grafana
--   console within a workspace. For more information, see <a>User
--   authentication in Amazon Managed Grafana</a>.
createWorkspace_authenticationProviders :: Lens' CreateWorkspace [AuthenticationProviderTypes]

-- | If you specify <tt>Service Managed</tt>, Amazon Managed Grafana
--   automatically creates the IAM roles and provisions the permissions
--   that the workspace needs to use Amazon Web Services data sources and
--   notification channels.
--   
--   If you specify <tt>CUSTOMER_MANAGED</tt>, you will manage those roles
--   and permissions yourself. If you are creating this workspace in a
--   member account of an organization that is not a delegated
--   administrator account, and you want the workspace to access data
--   sources in other Amazon Web Services accounts in the organization, you
--   must choose <tt>CUSTOMER_MANAGED</tt>.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Amazon Managed Grafana permissions and
--   policies for Amazon Web Services data sources and notification
--   channels</a>
createWorkspace_permissionType :: Lens' CreateWorkspace PermissionType

-- | The response's http status code.
createWorkspaceResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' CreateWorkspaceResponse Int

-- | A structure containing data about the workspace that was created.
createWorkspaceResponse_workspace :: Lens' CreateWorkspaceResponse WorkspaceDescription

-- | The name of the attribute within the SAML assertion to use as the
--   email names for SAML users.
assertionAttributes_email :: Lens' AssertionAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the attribute within the SAML assertion to use as the user
--   full "friendly" names for user groups.
assertionAttributes_groups :: Lens' AssertionAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the attribute within the SAML assertion to use as the user
--   full "friendly" names for the users' organizations.
assertionAttributes_org :: Lens' AssertionAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the attribute within the SAML assertion to use as the user
--   roles.
assertionAttributes_role :: Lens' AssertionAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the attribute within the SAML assertion to use as the user
--   full "friendly" names for SAML users.
assertionAttributes_name :: Lens' AssertionAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the attribute within the SAML assertion to use as the
--   login names for SAML users.
assertionAttributes_login :: Lens' AssertionAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | A structure containing information about how this workspace works with
--   Amazon Web Services SSO.
authenticationDescription_awsSso :: Lens' AuthenticationDescription (Maybe AwsSsoAuthentication)

-- | A structure containing information about how this workspace works with
--   SAML, including what attributes within the assertion are to be mapped
--   to user information in the workspace.
authenticationDescription_saml :: Lens' AuthenticationDescription (Maybe SamlAuthentication)

-- | Specifies whether this workspace uses Amazon Web Services SSO, SAML,
--   or both methods to authenticate users to use the Grafana console in
--   the Amazon Managed Grafana workspace.
authenticationDescription_providers :: Lens' AuthenticationDescription [AuthenticationProviderTypes]

-- | Specifies whether the workplace's user authentication method is fully
--   configured.
authenticationSummary_samlConfigurationStatus :: Lens' AuthenticationSummary (Maybe SamlConfigurationStatus)

-- | Specifies whether the workspace uses SAML, Amazon Web Services SSO, or
--   both methods for user authentication.
authenticationSummary_providers :: Lens' AuthenticationSummary [AuthenticationProviderTypes]

-- | The ID of the Amazon Web Services SSO-managed application that is
--   created by Amazon Managed Grafana.
awsSsoAuthentication_ssoClientId :: Lens' AwsSsoAuthentication (Maybe Text)

-- | The URL of the location containing the metadata.
idpMetadata_url :: Lens' IdpMetadata (Maybe Text)

-- | The actual full metadata file, in XML format.
idpMetadata_xml :: Lens' IdpMetadata (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether the user or group has the <tt>Admin</tt> or
--   <tt>Editor</tt> role.
permissionEntry_role :: Lens' PermissionEntry Role

-- | A structure with the ID of the user or group with this role.
permissionEntry_user :: Lens' PermissionEntry User

-- | A list of groups from the SAML assertion attribute to grant the
--   Grafana <tt>Admin</tt> role to.
roleValues_admin :: Lens' RoleValues (Maybe [Text])

-- | A list of groups from the SAML assertion attribute to grant the
--   Grafana <tt>Editor</tt> role to.
roleValues_editor :: Lens' RoleValues (Maybe [Text])

-- | A structure containing details about how this workspace works with
--   SAML.
samlAuthentication_configuration :: Lens' SamlAuthentication (Maybe SamlConfiguration)

-- | Specifies whether the workspace's SAML configuration is complete.
samlAuthentication_status :: Lens' SamlAuthentication SamlConfigurationStatus

-- | How long a sign-on session by a SAML user is valid, before the user
--   has to sign on again.
samlConfiguration_loginValidityDuration :: Lens' SamlConfiguration (Maybe Int)

-- | A structure that defines which attributes in the SAML assertion are to
--   be used to define information about the users authenticated by that
--   IdP to use the workspace.
samlConfiguration_assertionAttributes :: Lens' SamlConfiguration (Maybe AssertionAttributes)

-- | Lists which organizations defined in the SAML assertion are allowed to
--   use the Amazon Managed Grafana workspace. If this is empty, all
--   organizations in the assertion attribute have access.
samlConfiguration_allowedOrganizations :: Lens' SamlConfiguration (Maybe [Text])

-- | A structure containing arrays that map group names in the SAML
--   assertion to the Grafana <tt>Admin</tt> and <tt>Editor</tt> roles in
--   the workspace.
samlConfiguration_roleValues :: Lens' SamlConfiguration (Maybe RoleValues)

-- | A structure containing the identity provider (IdP) metadata used to
--   integrate the identity provider with this workspace.
samlConfiguration_idpMetadata :: Lens' SamlConfiguration IdpMetadata

-- | Specifies which permission update caused the error.
updateError_causedBy :: Lens' UpdateError UpdateInstruction

-- | The error code.
updateError_code :: Lens' UpdateError Natural

-- | The message for this error.
updateError_message :: Lens' UpdateError Text

-- | Specifies whether this update is to add or revoke role permissions.
updateInstruction_action :: Lens' UpdateInstruction UpdateAction

-- | The role to add or revoke for the user or the group specified in
--   <tt>users</tt>.
updateInstruction_role :: Lens' UpdateInstruction Role

-- | A structure that specifies the user or group to add or revoke the role
--   for.
updateInstruction_users :: Lens' UpdateInstruction [User]

-- | The ID of the user or group.
user_id :: Lens' User Text

-- | Specifies whether this is a single user or a group.
user_type :: Lens' User UserType

-- | The IAM role that grants permissions to the Amazon Web Services
--   resources that the workspace will view data from. This role must
--   already exist.
workspaceDescription_workspaceRoleArn :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | If this workspace is currently in the free trial period for Grafana
--   Enterprise, this value specifies when that free trial ends.
workspaceDescription_freeTrialExpiration :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Specifies whether this workspace has a full Grafana Enterprise license
--   or a free trial license.
workspaceDescription_licenseType :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription (Maybe LicenseType)

-- | If this is <tt>Service Managed</tt>, Amazon Managed Grafana
--   automatically creates the IAM roles and provisions the permissions
--   that the workspace needs to use Amazon Web Services data sources and
--   notification channels.
--   
--   If this is <tt>CUSTOMER_MANAGED</tt>, you manage those roles and
--   permissions yourself. If you are creating this workspace in a member
--   account of an organization and that account is not a delegated
--   administrator account, and you want the workspace to access data
--   sources in other Amazon Web Services accounts in the organization, you
--   must choose <tt>CUSTOMER_MANAGED</tt>.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Amazon Managed Grafana permissions and
--   policies for Amazon Web Services data sources and notification
--   channels</a>
workspaceDescription_permissionType :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription (Maybe PermissionType)

-- | The name of the workspace.
workspaceDescription_name :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Web Services notification channels that Amazon Managed
--   Grafana can automatically create IAM roles and permissions for, to
--   allow Amazon Managed Grafana to use these channels.
workspaceDescription_notificationDestinations :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription (Maybe [NotificationDestinationType])

-- | Specifies whether the workspace can access Amazon Web Services
--   resources in this Amazon Web Services account only, or whether it can
--   also access Amazon Web Services resources in other accounts in the
--   same organization. If this is <tt>ORGANIZATION</tt>, the
--   <tt>workspaceOrganizationalUnits</tt> parameter specifies which
--   organizational units the workspace can access.
workspaceDescription_accountAccessType :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription (Maybe AccountAccessType)

-- | If this workspace has a full Grafana Enterprise license, this
--   specifies when the license ends and will need to be renewed.
workspaceDescription_licenseExpiration :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The name of the IAM role that is used to access resources through
--   Organizations.
workspaceDescription_organizationRoleName :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the CloudFormation stack set that is used to generate IAM
--   roles to be used for this workspace.
workspaceDescription_stackSetName :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the organizational units that this workspace is allowed to
--   use data sources from, if this workspace is in an account that is part
--   of an organization.
workspaceDescription_organizationalUnits :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription (Maybe [Text])

-- | The user-defined description of the workspace.
workspaceDescription_description :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether this workspace has already fully used its free trial
--   for Grafana Enterprise.
workspaceDescription_freeTrialConsumed :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription (Maybe Bool)

-- | A structure that describes whether the workspace uses SAML, Amazon Web
--   Services SSO, or both methods for user authentication.
workspaceDescription_authentication :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription AuthenticationSummary

-- | The date that the workspace was created.
workspaceDescription_created :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription UTCTime

-- | Specifies the Amazon Web Services data sources that have been
--   configured to have IAM roles and permissions created to allow Amazon
--   Managed Grafana to read data from these sources.
workspaceDescription_dataSources :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription [DataSourceType]

-- | The URL that users can use to access the Grafana console in the
--   workspace.
workspaceDescription_endpoint :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription Text

-- | The version of Grafana supported in this workspace.
workspaceDescription_grafanaVersion :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription Text

-- | The unique ID of this workspace.
workspaceDescription_id :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription Text

-- | The most recent date that the workspace was modified.
workspaceDescription_modified :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription UTCTime

-- | The current status of the workspace.
workspaceDescription_status :: Lens' WorkspaceDescription WorkspaceStatus

-- | The name of the workspace.
workspaceSummary_name :: Lens' WorkspaceSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Web Services notification channels that Amazon Managed
--   Grafana can automatically create IAM roles and permissions for, which
--   allows Amazon Managed Grafana to use these channels.
workspaceSummary_notificationDestinations :: Lens' WorkspaceSummary (Maybe [NotificationDestinationType])

-- | The customer-entered description of the workspace.
workspaceSummary_description :: Lens' WorkspaceSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | A structure containing information about the authentication methods
--   used in the workspace.
workspaceSummary_authentication :: Lens' WorkspaceSummary AuthenticationSummary

-- | The date that the workspace was created.
workspaceSummary_created :: Lens' WorkspaceSummary UTCTime

-- | The URL endpoint to use to access the Grafana console in the
--   workspace.
workspaceSummary_endpoint :: Lens' WorkspaceSummary Text

-- | The Grafana version that the workspace is running.
workspaceSummary_grafanaVersion :: Lens' WorkspaceSummary Text

-- | The unique ID of the workspace.
workspaceSummary_id :: Lens' WorkspaceSummary Text

-- | The most recent date that the workspace was modified.
workspaceSummary_modified :: Lens' WorkspaceSummary UTCTime

-- | The current status of the workspace.
workspaceSummary_status :: Lens' WorkspaceSummary WorkspaceStatus


module Amazonka.Grafana.Waiters


-- | Derived from API version <tt>2020-08-18</tt> of the AWS service
--   descriptions, licensed under Apache 2.0.
--   
--   Amazon Managed Grafana is a fully managed and secure data
--   visualization service that you can use to instantly query, correlate,
--   and visualize operational metrics, logs, and traces from multiple
--   sources. Amazon Managed Grafana makes it easy to deploy, operate, and
--   scale Grafana, a widely deployed data visualization tool that is
--   popular for its extensible data support.
--   
--   With Amazon Managed Grafana, you create logically isolated Grafana
--   servers called <i>workspaces</i>. In a workspace, you can create
--   Grafana dashboards and visualizations to analyze your metrics, logs,
--   and traces without having to build, package, or deploy any hardware to
--   run Grafana servers.
module Amazonka.Grafana

-- | API version <tt>2020-08-18</tt> of the Amazon Managed Grafana SDK
--   configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | The value of a parameter in the request caused an error.
_ValidationException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You do not have sufficient permissions to perform this action.
_AccessDeniedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | A resource was in an inconsistent state during an update or a
--   deletion.
_ConflictException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request would cause a service quota to be exceeded.
_ServiceQuotaExceededException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request was denied because of request throttling. Retry the
--   request.
_ThrottlingException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Unexpected error while processing the request. Retry the request.
_InternalServerException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request references a resource that does not exist.
_ResourceNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateWorkspace</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateWorkspace
UpdateWorkspace' :: Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe [DataSourceType] -> Maybe PermissionType -> Maybe [NotificationDestinationType] -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe AccountAccessType -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (Sensitive [Text]) -> Text -> UpdateWorkspace

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateWorkspace</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:workspaceRoleArn:UpdateWorkspace'</a>,
--   <a>updateWorkspace_workspaceRoleArn</a> - The workspace needs an IAM
--   role that grants permissions to the Amazon Web Services resources that
--   the workspace will view data from. If you already have a role that you
--   want to use, specify it here. If you omit this field and you specify
--   some Amazon Web Services resources in <tt>workspaceDataSources</tt> or
--   <tt>workspaceNotificationDestinations</tt>, a new IAM role with the
--   necessary permissions is automatically created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:workspaceDataSources:UpdateWorkspace'</a>,
--   <a>updateWorkspace_workspaceDataSources</a> - Specify the Amazon Web
--   Services data sources that you want to be queried in this workspace.
--   Specifying these data sources here enables Amazon Managed Grafana to
--   create IAM roles and permissions that allow Amazon Managed Grafana to
--   read data from these sources. You must still add them as data sources
--   in the Grafana console in the workspace.
--   
--   If you don't specify a data source here, you can still add it as a
--   data source later in the workspace console. However, you will then
--   have to manually configure permissions for it.
--   
--   <a>$sel:permissionType:UpdateWorkspace'</a>,
--   <a>updateWorkspace_permissionType</a> - If you specify <tt>Service
--   Managed</tt>, Amazon Managed Grafana automatically creates the IAM
--   roles and provisions the permissions that the workspace needs to use
--   Amazon Web Services data sources and notification channels.
--   
--   If you specify <tt>CUSTOMER_MANAGED</tt>, you will manage those roles
--   and permissions yourself. If you are creating this workspace in a
--   member account of an organization and that account is not a delegated
--   administrator account, and you want the workspace to access data
--   sources in other Amazon Web Services accounts in the organization, you
--   must choose <tt>CUSTOMER_MANAGED</tt>.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Amazon Managed Grafana permissions and
--   policies for Amazon Web Services data sources and notification
--   channels</a>
--   
--   <a>$sel:workspaceNotificationDestinations:UpdateWorkspace'</a>,
--   <a>updateWorkspace_workspaceNotificationDestinations</a> - Specify the
--   Amazon Web Services notification channels that you plan to use in this
--   workspace. Specifying these data sources here enables Amazon Managed
--   Grafana to create IAM roles and permissions that allow Amazon Managed
--   Grafana to use these channels.
--   
--   <a>$sel:workspaceName:UpdateWorkspace'</a>,
--   <a>updateWorkspace_workspaceName</a> - A new name for the workspace to
--   update.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountAccessType:UpdateWorkspace'</a>,
--   <a>updateWorkspace_accountAccessType</a> - Specifies whether the
--   workspace can access Amazon Web Services resources in this Amazon Web
--   Services account only, or whether it can also access Amazon Web
--   Services resources in other accounts in the same organization. If you
--   specify <tt>ORGANIZATION</tt>, you must specify which organizational
--   units the workspace can access in the
--   <tt>workspaceOrganizationalUnits</tt> parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:organizationRoleName:UpdateWorkspace'</a>,
--   <a>updateWorkspace_organizationRoleName</a> - The name of an IAM role
--   that already exists to use to access resources through Organizations.
--   
--   <a>$sel:workspaceDescription:UpdateWorkspace'</a>,
--   <a>updateWorkspace_workspaceDescription</a> - A description for the
--   workspace. This is used only to help you identify this workspace.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackSetName:UpdateWorkspace'</a>,
--   <a>updateWorkspace_stackSetName</a> - The name of the CloudFormation
--   stack set to use to generate IAM roles to be used for this workspace.
--   
--   <a>$sel:workspaceOrganizationalUnits:UpdateWorkspace'</a>,
--   <a>updateWorkspace_workspaceOrganizationalUnits</a> - Specifies the
--   organizational units that this workspace is allowed to use data
--   sources from, if this workspace is in an account that is part of an
--   organization.
--   
--   <a>$sel:workspaceId:UpdateWorkspace'</a>,
--   <a>updateWorkspace_workspaceId</a> - The ID of the workspace to
--   update.
newUpdateWorkspace :: Text -> UpdateWorkspace

--   optional fields omitted.

--   the assertion attribute are to have the <tt>Admin</tt> and

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListPermissions</a> smart constructor.
data ListPermissions
ListPermissions' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe UserType -> Text -> ListPermissions

-- | Create a value of <a>ListPermissions</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:userId:ListPermissions'</a>, <a>listPermissions_userId</a> -
--   (Optional) Limits the results to only the user that matches this ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListPermissions'</a>,
--   <a>listPermissions_nextToken</a> - The token to use when requesting
--   the next set of results. You received this token from a previous
--   <tt>ListPermissions</tt> operation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:groupId:ListPermissions'</a>, <a>listPermissions_groupId</a> -
--   (Optional) Limits the results to only the group that matches this ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListPermissions'</a>,
--   <a>listPermissions_maxResults</a> - The maximum number of results to
--   include in the response.
--   
--   <a>$sel:userType:ListPermissions'</a>, <a>listPermissions_userType</a>
--   - (Optional) If you specify <tt>SSO_USER</tt>, then only the
--   permissions of Amazon Web Services SSO users are returned. If you
--   specify <tt>SSO_GROUP</tt>, only the permissions of Amazon Web
--   Services SSO groups are returned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:workspaceId:ListPermissions'</a>,
--   <a>listPermissions_workspaceId</a> - The ID of the workspace to list
--   permissions for. This parameter is required.
newListPermissions :: Text -> ListPermissions

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListPermissionsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ListPermissionsResponse
ListPermissionsResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Int -> [PermissionEntry] -> ListPermissionsResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>ListPermissionsResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListPermissions'</a>,
--   <a>listPermissionsResponse_nextToken</a> - The token to use in a
--   subsequent <tt>ListPermissions</tt> operation to return the next set
--   of results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ListPermissionsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listPermissionsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:permissions:ListPermissionsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listPermissionsResponse_permissions</a> - The permissions returned
--   by the operation.
newListPermissionsResponse :: Int -> ListPermissionsResponse

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdatePermissions</a> smart constructor.
data UpdatePermissions
UpdatePermissions' :: [UpdateInstruction] -> Text -> UpdatePermissions

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdatePermissions</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:updateInstructionBatch:UpdatePermissions'</a>,
--   <a>updatePermissions_updateInstructionBatch</a> - An array of
--   structures that contain the permission updates to make.
--   
--   <a>$sel:workspaceId:UpdatePermissions'</a>,
--   <a>updatePermissions_workspaceId</a> - The ID of the workspace to
--   update.
newUpdatePermissions :: Text -> UpdatePermissions

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdatePermissionsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data UpdatePermissionsResponse
UpdatePermissionsResponse' :: Int -> [UpdateError] -> UpdatePermissionsResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdatePermissionsResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:UpdatePermissionsResponse'</a>,

--   status code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errors:UpdatePermissionsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>updatePermissionsResponse_errors</a> - An array of structures that
--   contain the errors from the operation, if any.
newUpdatePermissionsResponse :: Int -> UpdatePermissionsResponse

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDisassociateLicense</a> smart constructor.
data DisassociateLicense

--   omitted.

--   remove the Grafana Enterprise license from.

--   information about the workspace.
newDisassociateLicenseResponse :: Int -> WorkspaceDescription -> DisassociateLicenseResponse

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateWorkspace</a> smart constructor.
data CreateWorkspace
CreateWorkspace' :: Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [DataSourceType] -> Maybe [NotificationDestinationType] -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (Sensitive [Text]) -> AccountAccessType -> [AuthenticationProviderTypes] -> PermissionType -> CreateWorkspace

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateWorkspace</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:workspaceRoleArn:CreateWorkspace'</a>,
--   <a>createWorkspace_workspaceRoleArn</a> - The workspace needs an IAM
--   role that grants permissions to the Amazon Web Services resources that
--   the workspace will view data from. If you already have a role that you
--   want to use, specify it here. If you omit this field and you specify
--   some Amazon Web Services resources in <tt>workspaceDataSources</tt> or
--   <tt>workspaceNotificationDestinations</tt>, a new IAM role with the
--   necessary permissions is automatically created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientToken:CreateWorkspace'</a>,
--   <a>createWorkspace_clientToken</a> - A unique, case-sensitive,
--   user-provided identifier to ensure the idempotency of the request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:workspaceDataSources:CreateWorkspace'</a>,
--   <a>createWorkspace_workspaceDataSources</a> - Specify the Amazon Web
--   Services data sources that you want to be queried in this workspace.
--   Specifying these data sources here enables Amazon Managed Grafana to
--   create IAM roles and permissions that allow Amazon Managed Grafana to
--   read data from these sources. You must still add them as data sources
--   in the Grafana console in the workspace.
--   
--   If you don't specify a data source here, you can still add it as a
--   data source in the workspace console later. However, you will then
--   have to manually configure permissions for it.
--   
--   <a>$sel:workspaceNotificationDestinations:CreateWorkspace'</a>,
--   <a>createWorkspace_workspaceNotificationDestinations</a> - Specify the
--   Amazon Web Services notification channels that you plan to use in this
--   workspace. Specifying these data sources here enables Amazon Managed
--   Grafana to create IAM roles and permissions that allow Amazon Managed
--   Grafana to use these channels.
--   
--   <a>$sel:workspaceName:CreateWorkspace'</a>,
--   <a>createWorkspace_workspaceName</a> - The name for the workspace. It
--   does not have to be unique.
--   
--   <a>$sel:organizationRoleName:CreateWorkspace'</a>,
--   <a>createWorkspace_organizationRoleName</a> - The name of an IAM role
--   that already exists to use with Organizations to access Amazon Web
--   Services data sources and notification channels in other accounts in
--   an organization.
--   
--   <a>$sel:workspaceDescription:CreateWorkspace'</a>,
--   <a>createWorkspace_workspaceDescription</a> - A description for the
--   workspace. This is used only to help you identify this workspace.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackSetName:CreateWorkspace'</a>,
--   <a>createWorkspace_stackSetName</a> - The name of the CloudFormation
--   stack set to use to generate IAM roles to be used for this workspace.
--   
--   <a>$sel:workspaceOrganizationalUnits:CreateWorkspace'</a>,
--   <a>createWorkspace_workspaceOrganizationalUnits</a> - Specifies the
--   organizational units that this workspace is allowed to use data
--   sources from, if this workspace is in an account that is part of an
--   organization.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountAccessType:CreateWorkspace'</a>,
--   <a>createWorkspace_accountAccessType</a> - Specifies whether the
--   workspace can access Amazon Web Services resources in this Amazon Web
--   Services account only, or whether it can also access Amazon Web
--   Services resources in other accounts in the same organization. If you
--   specify <tt>ORGANIZATION</tt>, you must specify which organizational
--   units the workspace can access in the
--   <tt>workspaceOrganizationalUnits</tt> parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:authenticationProviders:CreateWorkspace'</a>,
--   <a>createWorkspace_authenticationProviders</a> - Specifies whether
--   this workspace uses SAML 2.0, Amazon Web Services Single Sign On, or
--   both to authenticate users for using the Grafana console within a
--   workspace. For more information, see <a>User authentication in Amazon
--   Managed Grafana</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:permissionType:CreateWorkspace'</a>,
--   <a>createWorkspace_permissionType</a> - If you specify <tt>Service
--   Managed</tt>, Amazon Managed Grafana automatically creates the IAM
--   roles and provisions the permissions that the workspace needs to use
--   Amazon Web Services data sources and notification channels.
--   
--   If you specify <tt>CUSTOMER_MANAGED</tt>, you will manage those roles
--   and permissions yourself. If you are creating this workspace in a
--   member account of an organization that is not a delegated
--   administrator account, and you want the workspace to access data
--   sources in other Amazon Web Services accounts in the organization, you
--   must choose <tt>CUSTOMER_MANAGED</tt>.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Amazon Managed Grafana permissions and
--   policies for Amazon Web Services data sources and notification
--   channels</a>
newCreateWorkspace :: AccountAccessType -> PermissionType -> CreateWorkspace

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateWorkspaceResponse</a> smart constructor.
data CreateWorkspaceResponse
CreateWorkspaceResponse' :: Int -> WorkspaceDescription -> CreateWorkspaceResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateWorkspaceResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:CreateWorkspaceResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createWorkspaceResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:workspace:CreateWorkspaceResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createWorkspaceResponse_workspace</a> - A structure containing data
--   about the workspace that was created.
newCreateWorkspaceResponse :: Int -> WorkspaceDescription -> CreateWorkspaceResponse
newtype AccountAccessType
AccountAccessType' :: Text -> AccountAccessType
[fromAccountAccessType] :: AccountAccessType -> Text
pattern AccountAccessType_CURRENT_ACCOUNT :: AccountAccessType
pattern AccountAccessType_ORGANIZATION :: AccountAccessType
newtype AuthenticationProviderTypes
AuthenticationProviderTypes' :: Text -> AuthenticationProviderTypes
[fromAuthenticationProviderTypes] :: AuthenticationProviderTypes -> Text
pattern AuthenticationProviderTypes_AWS_SSO :: AuthenticationProviderTypes
pattern AuthenticationProviderTypes_SAML :: AuthenticationProviderTypes
newtype DataSourceType
DataSourceType' :: Text -> DataSourceType
[fromDataSourceType] :: DataSourceType -> Text
pattern DataSourceType_AMAZON_OPENSEARCH_SERVICE :: DataSourceType
pattern DataSourceType_CLOUDWATCH :: DataSourceType
pattern DataSourceType_PROMETHEUS :: DataSourceType
pattern DataSourceType_SITEWISE :: DataSourceType
pattern DataSourceType_TIMESTREAM :: DataSourceType
pattern DataSourceType_XRAY :: DataSourceType
newtype LicenseType
LicenseType' :: Text -> LicenseType
[fromLicenseType] :: LicenseType -> Text
pattern LicenseType_ENTERPRISE :: LicenseType
pattern LicenseType_ENTERPRISE_FREE_TRIAL :: LicenseType
newtype NotificationDestinationType
NotificationDestinationType' :: Text -> NotificationDestinationType
[fromNotificationDestinationType] :: NotificationDestinationType -> Text
pattern NotificationDestinationType_SNS :: NotificationDestinationType
newtype PermissionType
PermissionType' :: Text -> PermissionType
[fromPermissionType] :: PermissionType -> Text
pattern PermissionType_CUSTOMER_MANAGED :: PermissionType
pattern PermissionType_SERVICE_MANAGED :: PermissionType
newtype Role
Role' :: Text -> Role
[fromRole] :: Role -> Text
pattern Role_ADMIN :: Role
pattern Role_EDITOR :: Role
newtype SamlConfigurationStatus
SamlConfigurationStatus' :: Text -> SamlConfigurationStatus
[fromSamlConfigurationStatus] :: SamlConfigurationStatus -> Text
pattern SamlConfigurationStatus_CONFIGURED :: SamlConfigurationStatus
pattern SamlConfigurationStatus_NOT_CONFIGURED :: SamlConfigurationStatus
newtype UpdateAction
UpdateAction' :: Text -> UpdateAction
[fromUpdateAction] :: UpdateAction -> Text
pattern UpdateAction_ADD :: UpdateAction
pattern UpdateAction_REVOKE :: UpdateAction
newtype UserType
UserType' :: Text -> UserType
[fromUserType] :: UserType -> Text
pattern UserType_SSO_GROUP :: UserType
pattern UserType_SSO_USER :: UserType
newtype WorkspaceStatus
WorkspaceStatus' :: Text -> WorkspaceStatus
[fromWorkspaceStatus] :: WorkspaceStatus -> Text
pattern WorkspaceStatus_ACTIVE :: WorkspaceStatus
pattern WorkspaceStatus_CREATING :: WorkspaceStatus
pattern WorkspaceStatus_CREATION_FAILED :: WorkspaceStatus
pattern WorkspaceStatus_DELETING :: WorkspaceStatus
pattern WorkspaceStatus_DELETION_FAILED :: WorkspaceStatus
pattern WorkspaceStatus_FAILED :: WorkspaceStatus
pattern WorkspaceStatus_LICENSE_REMOVAL_FAILED :: WorkspaceStatus
pattern WorkspaceStatus_UPDATE_FAILED :: WorkspaceStatus
pattern WorkspaceStatus_UPDATING :: WorkspaceStatus
pattern WorkspaceStatus_UPGRADE_FAILED :: WorkspaceStatus
pattern WorkspaceStatus_UPGRADING :: WorkspaceStatus

-- | A structure that defines which attributes in the IdP assertion are to
--   be used to define information about the users authenticated by the IdP
--   to use the workspace.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAssertionAttributes</a> smart constructor.
data AssertionAttributes
AssertionAttributes' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> AssertionAttributes

-- | Create a value of <a>AssertionAttributes</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:email:AssertionAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>assertionAttributes_email</a> - The name of the attribute within
--   the SAML assertion to use as the email names for SAML users.
--   
--   <a>$sel:groups:AssertionAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>assertionAttributes_groups</a> - The name of the attribute within
--   the SAML assertion to use as the user full "friendly" names for user
--   groups.
--   
--   <a>$sel:org:AssertionAttributes'</a>, <a>assertionAttributes_org</a> -
--   The name of the attribute within the SAML assertion to use as the user
--   full "friendly" names for the users' organizations.
--   
--   <a>$sel:role':AssertionAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>assertionAttributes_role</a> - The name of the attribute within the
--   SAML assertion to use as the user roles.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:AssertionAttributes'</a>, <a>assertionAttributes_name</a>
--   - The name of the attribute within the SAML assertion to use as the
--   user full "friendly" names for SAML users.
--   
--   <a>$sel:login:AssertionAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>assertionAttributes_login</a> - The name of the attribute within
--   the SAML assertion to use as the login names for SAML users.
newAssertionAttributes :: AssertionAttributes

-- | A structure containing information about the user authentication
--   methods used by the workspace.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAuthenticationDescription</a> smart constructor.
data AuthenticationDescription
AuthenticationDescription' :: Maybe AwsSsoAuthentication -> Maybe SamlAuthentication -> [AuthenticationProviderTypes] -> AuthenticationDescription

-- | Create a value of <a>AuthenticationDescription</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:awsSso:AuthenticationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>authenticationDescription_awsSso</a> - A structure containing
--   information about how this workspace works with Amazon Web Services
--   SSO.
--   
--   <a>$sel:saml:AuthenticationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>authenticationDescription_saml</a> - A structure containing
--   information about how this workspace works with SAML, including what
--   attributes within the assertion are to be mapped to user information
--   in the workspace.
--   
--   <a>$sel:providers:AuthenticationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>authenticationDescription_providers</a> - Specifies whether this
--   workspace uses Amazon Web Services SSO, SAML, or both methods to
--   authenticate users to use the Grafana console in the Amazon Managed
--   Grafana workspace.
newAuthenticationDescription :: AuthenticationDescription

-- | A structure that describes whether the workspace uses SAML, Amazon Web
--   Services SSO, or both methods for user authentication, and whether
--   that authentication is fully configured.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAuthenticationSummary</a> smart constructor.
data AuthenticationSummary
AuthenticationSummary' :: Maybe SamlConfigurationStatus -> [AuthenticationProviderTypes] -> AuthenticationSummary

-- | Create a value of <a>AuthenticationSummary</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:samlConfigurationStatus:AuthenticationSummary'</a>,
--   <a>authenticationSummary_samlConfigurationStatus</a> - Specifies
--   whether the workplace's user authentication method is fully
--   configured.
--   
--   <a>$sel:providers:AuthenticationSummary'</a>,
--   <a>authenticationSummary_providers</a> - Specifies whether the
--   workspace uses SAML, Amazon Web Services SSO, or both methods for user
--   authentication.
newAuthenticationSummary :: AuthenticationSummary

-- | A structure containing information about how this workspace works with
--   Amazon Web Services SSO.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAwsSsoAuthentication</a> smart constructor.
data AwsSsoAuthentication

-- | Create a value of <a>AwsSsoAuthentication</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
